1.2:
Instead, in the law of Yahweh is his delight,
and on his law he meditates day and night.
1.3:
And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water
that gives its fruit in its season;
its leaf also does not wither.
Therefore all that he does prospers.
1.4:
Not so the wicked.
Instead, they are like the chaff that the wind scatters.
1.5:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous;
1.6:
for Yahweh knows the way of the righteous,
but the way of the wicked will perish.

2.1:
Why are nations in tumult,
and countries plotting in vain?
2.2:
The kings of the earth establish themselves,
and the rulers conspire together
against Yahweh and his anointed:
2.3:
“Let us tear off their bonds,
and cast their cords from us!”
2.4:
He who sits enthroned in the heavens laughs.
The Lord derides them.
2.5:
Then he speaks to them in his wrath,
and in his fury he terrifies them:
2.6:
“But as for me, I have set my king
on Zion, my holy mountain.”
2.8:
Ask from me and I will make the nations your heritage,
and your possession the ends of the earth.
2.9:
You will break them with an iron rod.
Like a potter’s vessel you will shatter them.”
2.10:
So then, O kings, be wise.
Be warned, O rulers of the earth.
2.11:
Serve Yahweh with fear,
and rejoice with trembling.
2.12:
Kiss the Son
lest he be angry and you perish on the way,
for his anger burns quickly.
Blessed are all who take refuge in him.

3.1:
Yahweh, how many are my enemies;
many are rising against me.
3.2:
Many are saying about my soul,
“There is no deliverance for him from God. Selah
3.3:
But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me,
my glory and the one who lifts up my head.
3.4:
With my voice I call to Yahweh
and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah
3.5:
I lay down and slept;
I woke up because Yahweh sustains me.
3.6:
I am not afraid of the ten thousands of people
who all around have set themselves against me.
3.8:
To Yahweh belongs deliverance;
may your blessing be over your people. Selah

4.1:
When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness.
In trouble deliver me.
Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.
4.2:
O sons of man, how long will my honor be a disgrace?
How long will you love vanity?
How long will you seek lies? Selah
4.3:
But know that Yahweh has set apart for himself the faithful one.
Yahweh hears when I call to him.
4.4:
Be disturbed but do not sin.
Commune in your heart on your bed and be silent. Selah
4.5:
Offer correct sacrifices,
and trust in Yahweh.
4.6:
Many are saying, “Who will show us something good?”
Lift up over us the light of your face, O Yahweh.
4.7:
You have put gladness in my heart
more than when their grain and their wine abound.
4.8:
In peace I will lie down and sleep at once,
for you alone, O Yahweh, make me dwell safely.

5.1:
Hear my words, O Yahweh.
Give heed to my sighing.
5.2:
Listen to the sound of my pleading, my king and my God,
for to you I pray.
5.3:
O Yahweh, in the morning you will hear my voice.
In the morning I will set forth my case to you and I will watch.
5.4:
For you are not a God who desires wickedness.
Evil cannot dwell with you.
5.5:
The boastful do not stand before your eyes.
You hate all evildoers.
5.6:
You destroy speakers of lies.
A man of bloodshed and deceit Yahweh abhors.
5.7:
But as for me, through the abundance of your steadfast love
I will enter your house.
I will bow down toward your holy temple in awe of you.
5.8:
O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies;
make straight before me your way.
5.10:
Treat them as guilty, O God;
let them fall because of their plans.
Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out,
for they have rebelled against you.
5.11:
But let all who take shelter in you rejoice.
Let them ever sing for joy,
because you spread protection over them;
And let those who love your name exult in you.
5.12:
For you bless the righteous.
O Yahweh, like a shield you surround him with good favor.

6.1:
O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger,
and do not discipline me in your wrath.
6.2:
Be gracious to me, O Yahweh, because I am feeble.
Heal me, O Yahweh, for my bones are terrified.
6.3:
My soul is also very terrified.
But you, O Yahweh, how long?
6.4:
Turn, O Yahweh; deliver my life.
Save me for the sake of your steadfast love.
6.5:
For there is no remembrance of you in death.
In Sheol, who will give thanks to you?
6.7:
My eye wastes away because of vexation;
it grows old because of all my oppressors.
6.8:
Depart from me, all workers of evil,
for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.
6.9:
Yahweh has heard my plea;
Yahweh has accepted my prayer.
6.10:
All my enemies shall be ashamed and shall be very terrified.
They shall turn back; they shall suddenly be ashamed.

7.1:
O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge.
Save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me.
7.2:
Or else he will tear me apart like a lion,
ripping to pieces, with none to deliver.
7.3:
O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this,
if there is wrong in my hands,
7.4:
if I have repaid my ally with harm,
or if I have plundered my enemy without cause,
7.6:
Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger,
and lift yourself up against the wrath of my oppressors,
and awake for me,
since you have commanded judgment.
7.7:
And let the assembly of peoples surround you,
and over it return on high.
7.8:
Yahweh judges the nations.
O Yahweh, vindicate me
according to my innocence and according to my integrity within me.
7.9:
Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous,
and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.
7.10:
My shield is with God
who saves the upright of heart.
7.11:
God is a righteous judge,
and a God who has indignation every day.
7.12:
If he does not repent, he will sharpen his sword.
He has bent his bow and he has strung it.
7.13:
And he has prepared for him weapons of death.
He has made his arrows fiery shafts.
7.14:
See, he travails with evil.
He is pregnant with trouble,
and he gives birth to deception.
7.15:
He makes a pit and digs it out,
then falls in the trap he has made.
7.16:
His trouble comes back on his head,
and his violence comes down on his skull.
7.17:
I will thank Yahweh according to his righteousness,
and I will sing praise to the name of Yahweh, the Most High.

8.1:
Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth,
who put your splendor above the heavens.
8.2:
From the mouth of children and infants you have founded strength
on account of your enemies,
to silence the enemy and the avenger.
8.3:
When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers,
the moon and the stars which you set in place—
8.4:
what is a human being that you think of him?
and a child of humankind that you care for him?
8.5:
And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings,
and with glory and with majesty you crowned him.
8.6:
You make him over the works of your hands;
all things you have placed under his feet:
8.7:
sheep and cattle, all of them,
and also the wild animals of the field,
8.8:
the birds of the sky and the fish of the sea,
everything that passes along the paths of seas.
8.9:
Yahweh, our Lord,
how majestic is your name in all of the earth!

9.1:
I will thank Yahweh with all my heart.
I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
9.2:
I will be glad and rejoice in you.
I will sing the praise of your name, O Most High.
9.3:
When my enemies turn back,
they will stumble and perish because of your presence.
9.4:
For you have maintained my just cause;
you have sat on the throne judging correctly.
9.5:
You have rebuked the nations;
you have destroyed the wicked.
Their name you have blotted out
forever and ever.
9.7:
But Yahweh sits enthroned forever.
He has established his throne for judgment.
9.8:
And he will judge the world with righteousness.
He will judge the peoples with equity.
9.9:
And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
a stronghold in times of distress.
9.10:
And those who know your name will trust in you,
for you do not forsake those who seek you, O Yahweh.
9.11:
Sing praises to Yahweh who sits enthroned in Zion.
Tell his deeds among the peoples,
9.12:
for he who avenges bloodshed remembers them.
He does not forget the distressed cry of the afflicted.
9.13:
Be gracious to me, O Yahweh.
See my suffering from those who hate me,
you who lift me up from the gates of death,
9.14:
so that I may tell of all your praises.
In the gates of the daughter of Zion
let me rejoice in your salvation.
9.15:
The nations have fallen in the pit that they made;
their foot is caught in the net that they hid.
9.17:
The wicked shall turn back to Sheol,
all the nations forgetting God,
9.18:
for the needy shall not always be forgotten;
the hope of the poor shall never perish.
9.19:
Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans prevail;
let the nations be judged before you.
9.20:
O Yahweh, put them in fear.
Let the nations know they are merely human. Selah

10.1:
Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off?
Why do you hide during times of distress?
10.2:
In arrogance the wicked persecutes the poor.
Let them be caught in the schemes that they devised,
10.3:
for the wicked boasts about the desire of his heart,
and the one greedy for gain curses and treats Yahweh with contempt.
10.4:
With bald-faced pride the wicked will not seek God.
There is no God in any of his thoughts.
10.5:
His ways endure at all times.
Your judgments are aloof from him.
As for all his enemies, he scoffs at them.
10.6:
He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved
throughout all generations, during which I will have no trouble.”
10.10:
He is crushed; he is bowed down;
so the helpless host falls by his might.
10.11:
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten.
He has hidden his face.
He never sees.”
10.13:
Why does the wicked treat God with contempt?
He says in his heart, “You will not call me to account.”
10.14:
But you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief
to take it into your hand.
The helpless abandons himself upon you;
you have been the helper for the orphan.
10.15:
Break the arm of the wicked,
and as for the evil man—
seek out his wickedness until you find none.
10.16:
Yahweh is king forever and ever;
the nations have perished from his land.
10.17:
The longing of the afflicted you have heard, O Yahweh.
You will make their heart secure. You will listen attentively
10.18:
to render judgment for the fatherless and the oppressed
so that a mere mortal from the earth will no longer cause terror.

11.2:
For look: The wicked string the bow.
They have fitted their arrow to the string,
to shoot from the darkness
at the upright of heart.
11.3:
When the foundations are destroyed
what can the righteous do?
11.5:
Yahweh tests the righteous,
but the wicked and the lover of violence
his soul hates.
11.6:
He will rain coals on the wicked.
Burning sulfur and scorching wind
will be the portion of their cup.

12.2:
They speak falseness to each other.
With flattering lips,
with a double heart they speak.
12.3:
May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips,
the tongue speaking great boasts—
12.4:
those who say, “With our tongue we will prevail.
Our lips are on our side.
Who is master over us?”
12.5:
“Because of the oppression of the afflicted,
because of the groaning of the poor,
now I will rise up,” Yahweh says.
“I shall put them in the safety for which they long.”
12.6:
The words of Yahweh are pure words
like silver refined in the crucible on the ground,
refined seven times.
12.7:
You, O Yahweh, will protect them.
You will preserve him
from this generation always.
12.8:
The wicked prowl about
when vileness is exalted among the children of humankind.

13.1:
How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you hide your face from me?
13.2:
How long must I take counsel in my soul,
and sorrow in my heart all the day?
How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
13.3:
Consider and answer me, O Yahweh my God.
Give light to my eyes
lest I sleep the sleep of death,
13.4:
and lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,”
lest my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.
13.5:
But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love.
My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
13.6:
I will sing to Yahweh
because he has dealt bountifully with me.

14.1:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt.
They do abominable deeds.
There is none who does good.
14.2:
Yahweh looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind
to see whether there is one who has insight,
one who cares about God.
14.4:
All who do evil—do they not know,
they who eat my people as though they were eating bread?
They do not call on Yahweh.
14.5:
There they are very fearful
because God is with the generation of the righteous.
14.6:
You would put to shame the plan of the poor,
because Yahweh is his refuge.
14.7:
Oh that from Zion would come salvation for Israel!
When Yahweh returns the fortunes of his people,
Jacob will rejoice; Israel will be happy.

15.1:
O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent?
Who may dwell on your holy mountain?
15.2:
He who walks blamelessly and does what is right.
He who speaks honestly in his heart.
15.3:
He does not slander with his tongue.
He does not harm his friend,
nor bring up a disgrace against his neighbor.
15.4:
In his eyes a rejected one is contemptible,
but he honors those who respect Yahweh.
He takes an oath to his own injury and does not retract it.
15.5:
He does not lend his money at interest,
and does not take a bribe against the innocent.
He who does these things
will never be shaken.

16.1:
Protect me, O God,
for I take refuge in you.
16.2:
Oh my soul you have said to Yahweh, “You are my Lord.
I have no good apart from you.”
16.3:
With regard to the saints who are in the land,
they are the noble ones in whom is all my desire.
16.4:
Those who hurry after another god increase their sorrows.
I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood,
nor take up their names on my lips.
16.5:
Yahweh is the portion which is my share and my cup.
You hold my lot.
16.6:
The measuring lines have fallen for me in pleasant places.
Yes, my inheritance is delightful for me.
16.7:
I will bless Yahweh who advises me;
yes, at night my innermost being instructs me.
16.8:
I have set Yahweh before me always.
Because he is at my right hand I will not be shaken.
16.9:
Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices.
Yes, my body will dwell in safety,
16.10:
for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol;
you will not give your faithful one to see the grave.
16.11:
You will make known to me the path of life.
In your presence is fullness of joy.
At your right hand are pleasures forever.

17.1:
O Yahweh, hear a just cause.
Hear my cry; heed my prayer
I make without deceitful lips.
17.2:
Let my vindication come forth from you;
let your eyes see fairness.
17.4:
As for the works of humankind,
by the word of your lips,
I have kept from the ways of the violent.
17.5:
I have held my steps in your path
My feet will not slip.
17.6:
As for me, I have called on you
because you will answer me, O God.
Incline your ear to me.
Hear my words.
17.7:
Show wondrously your acts of loyal love,
O Savior of those who take refuge
at your right hand
from those who rise up against them.
17.8:
Keep me as the apple of your eye.
Hide me in the shadow of your wings
17.10:
They have shut off their calloused heart;
with their mouth they speak arrogantly.
17.11:
Now they surround us at our every step.
They intend
to pin me to the ground.
17.12:
He is like a lion; he longs to tear apart,
and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.
17.13:
Rise up, O Yahweh, confront him.
Make him bow down.
Rescue with your sword my life from the wicked,
17.14:
from men by your hand, O Yahweh, from men of this world.
Their share is in this life, and you fill their stomach with your treasure.
They are satisfied with children.
They bequeath their excess to their children.
17.15:
By contrast, I in righteousness shall see your face.
Upon awakening I will be satisfied seeing your form.

18.1:
And he said:
“I love you, O Yahweh, my strength.”
18.2:
Yahweh is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer,
my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge,
my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.
18.3:
I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised,
and I was saved from my enemies.
18.4:
The ropes of death encircled me,
and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.
18.5:
The ropes of Sheol surrounded me;
the snares of death confronted me.
18.6:
In my trouble I called on Yahweh,
and to my God I cried for help.
He heard my voice from his temple,
and my cry for help
came up before his presence into his ears.
18.7:
Then the earth shook and quaked,
and the foundations of the mountains trembled,
and they staggered because he was angry.
18.8:
Smoke went forth from his nose,
and fire from his mouth consumed.
Burning coals blazed from him.
18.9:
So he bowed the heavens and came down
with a thick cloud under his feet.
18.10:
And he mounted a cherub and flew,
and he swooped down on wings of wind.
18.12:
From the brightness before him
his clouds passed over
with hail and coals of fire.
18.13:
And Yahweh thundered from the heavens,
and the Most High uttered his voice
with hail and coals of fire.
18.14:
And he shot his arrows and scattered them,
and many lightning bolts and routed them.
18.15:
Then the channels of the sea became visible,
and the foundations of the world were uncovered
by your rebuke, O Yahweh,
by the blast of the wind of your nose.
18.16:
He reached from on high; he seized me.
He drew me from many waters.
18.17:
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
and from those who hated me
because they were stronger than I.
18.18:
They confronted me on the day of disaster,
but Yahweh was my support.
18.19:
So he brought me out to a spacious place.
He delivered me because he delighted in me.
18.21:
Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh,
and have not acted wickedly against my God,
18.22:
because all his ordinances are before me,
and his statutes I have not removed from me,
18.23:
and I was blameless before him,
and I kept myself from my guilt.
18.24:
Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness,
according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
18.25:
To the loyal you show yourself loyal.
To the blameless you show yourself blameless.
18.26:
To the pure you show yourself pure.
but to the wicked you show yourself shrewd.
18.27:
For you deliver humble people,
but haughty eyes you humiliate.
18.28:
For you light my lamp;
Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.
18.29:
For with you I can charge a troop,
and with my God I can scale a wall.
18.30:
This God—his way is blameless.
The word of Yahweh is flawless.
He is a shield for all those who take refuge in him.
18.31:
For who is God apart from Yahweh,
and who is a rock except our God?
18.32:
The God who girded me with strength,
and made safe my way,
18.33:
he made my feet like the deer’s,
and on my high places he makes me stand.
18.34:
He trains my hands for war,
so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
18.35:
You also gave me the shield of your salvation,
and your right hand supported me,
and your humility made me great.
18.36:
You enlarged my step under me,
and my ankles did not slip.
18.37:
I chased my enemies and overtook them;
I did not turn back until they were finished off.
18.38:
I struck them and they were not able to stand up;
they fell under my feet.
18.39:
And you girded me with strength for the battle;
those rising against me you made to kneel under me.
18.40:
And you made my enemies turn their backs,
then I destroyed those who hated me.
18.41:
They cried out but there was no rescuer,
even to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.
18.42:
And I ground them like dust in the wind,
I emptied them out like mud of the streets.
18.44:
as soon as they heard, they obeyed me.
The children of a foreign land feigned obedience before me.
18.45:
The children of a foreign land lost heart,
and they came trembling from their strongholds.
18.46:
Yahweh lives, and blessed be my rock,
and may the God of my salvation be exalted—
18.47:
the God who executed vengeance for me,
and subdued peoples under me,
18.48:
who delivered me from my enemies.
Indeed, you exalted me higher than those who rose against me.
You delivered me from the man of violence.
18.49:
Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh,
and I will sing the praise of your name:
18.50:
the one who makes great victories for his king,
and who shows loyal love for his anointed,
to David and to his descendants forever.

19.1:
The heavens are telling the glory of God,
and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.
19.2:
Every day they pour forth speech,
and every night they tell knowledge.
19.3:
There is no speech and there are no words;
their sound is inaudible.
19.4:
Yet in all the world their line goes out,
and their words to the end of the world.
In them he has pitched a tent for the sun,
19.5:
and it is like a bridegroom
who comes out of his bridal chamber.
It is glad like a strong man
to run its course.
19.7:
The law of Yahweh is perfect, reviving life.
The testimony of Yahweh is firm, making wise the simple.
19.8:
The precepts of Yahweh are right, making the heart rejoice.
The command of Yahweh is pure, enlightening the eyes.
19.9:
The fear of Yahweh is pure, enduring forever.
The ordinances of Yahweh are true; they are righteous altogether,
19.10:
more desirable than gold, even much fine gold;
and sweeter than honey, even honey in the comb.
19.11:
Moreover, your servant is warned by them;
in keeping them is great reward.
19.12:
Who can perceive his errors?
Acquit me from hidden faults.
19.13:
Also, keep back your servant from arrogant sins;
let them not rule over me.
Then I shall be blameless,
and I shall be innocent of great transgression.
19.14:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
be acceptable in your presence,
O Yahweh, my rock and my redeemer.

20.1:
May Yahweh answer you in the day of trouble.
May the name of Jacob’s God protect you.
20.2:
May he send you help from the sanctuary,
and from Zion may he sustain you.
20.3:
May he remember all your offerings,
and your burnt offering may he regard favorably.
20.4:
May he give to you your heart’s desire,
and your every plan may he fulfill. Selah
20.5:
May we shout for joy over your victory,
and in the name of our God may we set up banners.
May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.
20.6:
Now I know that Yahweh will help his anointed.
He will answer him from his holy heaven
with the victorious power of his right hand.
20.7:
Some boast in chariots and others in horses,
but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.
20.8:
They will collapse and fall,
and we will rise and stand firm.
20.9:
Rescue, O Yahweh.
Let the king answer us when we call.

21.1:
O Yahweh, the king will rejoice in your strength,
and how greatly he will delight in your help.
21.2:
You have given him the desire of his heart,
and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
21.3:
For you meet him with blessings of good things.
You set on his head a crown of fine gold.
21.4:
He asked life from you; you gave it to him—
length of days forever and ever.
21.5:
His honor is great because of your help.
Splendor and majesty you have bestowed upon him.
21.6:
For you set on him blessings forever.
You make him glad with the joy of your presence.
21.7:
Because the king trusts Yahweh,
and through the steadfast love of the Most High
he shall not be moved.
21.8:
Your hand will find all your enemies;
your right hand will find those who hate you.
21.9:
You will make them like your fiery furnace
at the time of your appearance.
Yahweh will swallow them in his wrath
and fire will consume them.
21.10:
You will destroy their offspring from the earth,
and their descendants from among the children of humankind.
21.11:
Though they have plotted evil against you,
though they have planned a scheme, they will not prevail.
21.12:
For you will turn them to flight;
you will aim arrows on your bowstrings at their faces.
21.13:
Be exalted, O Yahweh, in your strength,
and we sing and praise your power.

22.1:
My God, my God why have you forsaken me?
Why are you far from helping me, far from the words of my groaning?
22.2:
O my God, I call by day and you do not answer,
and by night but I have no rest.
22.3:
Yet you are holy,
enthroned on the praises of Israel.
22.4:
Our ancestors trusted you;
they trusted and you delivered them.
22.5:
They cried to you and were saved;
they trusted you and were not ashamed.
22.6:
But I am a worm and not a man,
scorned by humankind and despised by people.
22.8:
“He trusts Yahweh. Let him rescue him.
Let him deliver him because he delights in him.”
22.9:
Yet you took me from the belly;
you made me trust while on my mother’s breasts.
22.10:
On you I was cast from the womb.
From my mother’s belly you have been my God.
22.12:
Many bulls have encircled me;
mighty bulls of Bashan have surrounded me.
22.13:
They open their mouth against me
like a lion tearing and roaring.
22.14:
I am poured out like water,
and all my bones are out of joint.
My heart is like wax;
it is melted within me.
22.17:
I can count all my bones;
they gaze, they look at me.
22.18:
They divide my garments among them,
and for my clothing they cast lots.
22.19:
But you, O Yahweh, do not remain distant.
O my help, hasten to help me.
22.20:
Rescue my life from the sword,
my only life from the power of the dogs.
22.21:
Save me from the mouth of the lion,
and from the horns of the wild oxen answer me.
22.22:
I will tell your name to my brothers;
inside the assembly I will praise you.
22.23:
You who revere Yahweh, praise him!
Glorify him, all you seed of Jacob,
and be in awe of him, all you seed of Israel,
22.25:
From you is my praise.
In the great assembly,
I will pay my vows before those who revere him.
22.26:
The afflicted will eat and will be satisfied.
Those who seek him will praise Yahweh.
May your heart live forever.
22.27:
All the ends of the earth
will remember and turn to Yahweh.
All the families of the nations
will worship before you.
22.28:
Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh,
and he rules over the nations.
22.29:
All the healthy ones of the earth will eat and worship.
Before him all of those descending into the dust will kneel,
even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
22.30:
Descendants will serve him.
Regarding the Lord, it will be told to the next generation.
22.31:
They will come and tell his saving deeds
to a people yet to be born, that he has done it.

23.1:
Yahweh is my shepherd;
I will not lack for anything.
23.2:
In grassy pastures he makes me lie down;
by quiet waters he leads me.
23.3:
He restores my life.
He leads me in correct paths
for the sake of his name.
23.4:
Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil
because you are with me.
Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
23.5:
You prepare before me a table
in the presence of my oppressors.
You anoint my head with oil;
my cup is overflowing.
23.6:
Surely goodness and loyal love will pursue me
all the days of my life,
and I will stay in the house of Yahweh
for a very long time.

24.1:
The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness,
the world and those who live in it,
24.2:
because he has founded it on the seas,
and has established it on the rivers.
24.3:
Who may ascend the mountain of Yahweh?
And who may stand in his holy place?
24.4:
He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart,
who does not lift up his soul to falseness,
and does not swear deceitfully.
24.5:
He will receive blessing from Yahweh,
and justice from the God of his salvation.
24.6:
Such is the sort of those who seek him,
those who seek your face, even Jacob. Selah
24.7:
Lift up your heads, O gates,
and rise up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory may enter.
24.9:
Lift up your heads, O gates,
and lift up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory may enter.
24.10:
Who is the king of glory?
Yahweh of hosts,
He is the king of glory! Selah

25.1: To you, O Yahweh, I lift up my soul.
25.2:
O my God, I trust you; let me not be put to shame.
Do not let my enemies exult over me.
25.3:
Indeed, none who wait for you should be put to shame.
Those who betray without cause should be put to shame.
25.4:
Make me know your ways, O Yahweh.
Teach me your paths.
25.5:
Cause me to walk in your truth and teach me,
because you are the God of my salvation.
I await you all day long.
25.6:
Remember your compassion, O Yahweh,
and your acts of loyal love,
because they are from of old.
25.7:
Do not remember
the sins of my youth or my transgressions.
According to your loyal love remember me if you will,
for the sake of your goodness, O Yahweh.
25.8:
Good and right is Yahweh;
therefore he instructs sinners in the way.
25.9:
He causes the humble to walk in justice,
and teaches the humble his way.
25.10:
All the paths of Yahweh are loyal love and faithfulness
for those who keep his covenant and statutes.
25.11:
Also, for the sake of your name, O Yahweh,
forgive my sin, because it is great.
25.12:
Who is the man fearing Yahweh?
He will instruct him in the way he should choose.
25.13:
His soul will lodge in prosperity,
and his offspring will possess the land.
25.14:
Intimate fellowship with Yahweh is for those who fear him,
and he makes known his covenant to them.
25.15:
My eyes are continually toward Yahweh,
because he will take my feet from the net.
25.16:
Turn to me and have mercy on me
because I am lonely and afflicted.
25.17:
Remove the troubles of my heart;
bring me out from my distresses.
25.18:
Consider my affliction and trouble,
and forgive all my sins.
25.19:
Consider that my enemies are many,
and they hate me with violent hatred.
25.20:
Protect my life and deliver me.
Let me not be put to shame, because I take shelter in you.
25.21:
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
because I wait for you.
25.22:
O God, redeem Israel
from all its troubles.

26.1:
Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity,
and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.
26.2:
Prove me, O Yahweh, and test me.
Try my innermost being and my mind.
26.3:
Because your loyal love is before my eyes,
and I walk about in your faithfulness.
26.4:
I do not sit with deceitful people,
nor will I go about with hypocrites.
26.5:
I hate the crowd of evildoers,
and with the wicked I will not sit.
26.6:
I will wash my hands in innocence,
and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,
26.7:
to declare with a voice of thanksgiving,
and tell of all your wondrous deeds.
26.8:
O Yahweh, I love the dwelling of your house,
and the place where your glory abides.
26.9:
Do not destroy me with the sinners,
nor my life with men of bloodshed,
26.10:
in whose hands is an evil plan,
and whose right hand is full of bribes.
26.11:
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity.
Redeem me and be gracious to me.
26.12:
My foot stands on level ground.
In assemblies I will bless Yahweh.

27.2:
When evildoers drew near against me to eat my flesh—
my adversaries and my enemies who drew near to me—
they themselves stumbled and fell.
27.3:
Though an army encamp against me,
my heart will not fear.
Though war arise against me,
even in this I will remain confident.
27.4:
One thing I have asked from Yahweh;
it I will seek:
that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life,
to behold the beauty of Yahweh,
and to consider his temple.
27.5:
Because he will hide me in his shelter in the day of trouble.
He will conceal me in the hiding place of his tent.
He will set me high upon a rock.
27.6:
And now my head will be high over my enemies round about me.
And I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy.
I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.
27.7:
Hear, O Yahweh, my voice when I call,
and be gracious to me and answer me.
27.8:
On your behalf my heart says, “Seek my face.”
Your face, O Yahweh, I do seek.
27.9:
Do not hide your face from me;
do not turn your servant away in anger.
You have been my help; do not abandon nor forsake me,
O God of my salvation.
27.10:
If my father or my mother forsake me,
then Yahweh will receive me.
27.11:
Teach me, O Yahweh, your way,
and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.
27.12:
Do not give me over to the desire of my enemies,
because false witnesses have arisen against me,
and each breathing out violence.
27.13:
Surely I believe that I will see the goodness of Yahweh
in the land of the living.
27.14:
Wait for Yahweh.
Be strong and let your heart show strength,
and wait for Yahweh.

28.1:
To you, O Yahweh, I call.
O my rock, do not be deaf to me.
Or else, if you are silent to me,
then I will become like those descending to the pit.
28.2:
Hear the voice of my supplications
when I cry to you for help,
when I lift up my hands
toward your holy inner sanctuary.
28.3:
Do not drag me away with the wicked
or with the workers of evil,
who speak of peace with their neighbors,
while evil is in their heart.
28.4:
Give to them according to their work,
even according to the evil of their deeds.
Give to them according to the work of their hands;
repay them their rightful due.
28.5:
Because they do not regard the works of Yahweh,
nor the work of his hands,
he will destroy them
and not rebuild them.
28.6:
Blessed is Yahweh,
because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
28.7:
Yahweh is my strength and my shield.
My heart trusts him and I am helped.
So my heart rejoices,
and with my song I will give thanks to him.
28.8:
Yahweh is their strength,
and he is the refuge for the salvation of his anointed one.
28.9:
Save your people
and bless your heritage.
Shepherd them also and carry them always.

29.1:
Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God,
ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
29.2:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name.
Worship Yahweh in holy array.
29.4:
The voice of Yahweh is powerful.
The voice of Yahweh is majestic.
29.5:
The voice of Yahweh breaks the cedars.
Yahweh shatters even the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6:
And he makes them skip like a calf;
Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
29.7: The voice of Yahweh flashes flames of fire.
29.8:
The voice of Yahweh shakes the wilderness.
Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
29.9:
The voice of Yahweh causes deer to give birth
and strips the forests bare.
And at his temple all in it say, “Glory!”
29.10:
Yahweh sits enthroned at the flood,
and Yahweh sits as king forever.
29.11:
May Yahweh give strength to his people.
May Yahweh bless his people with peace.

30.1:
I will exalt you, O Yahweh,
because you have drawn me up,
and have not made my enemies rejoice over me.
30.2:
O Yahweh, my God,
I cried for help to you,
and you healed me.
30.3:
O Yahweh, you have brought my life up from Sheol.
You preserved me alive
from among those going down to the pit.
30.4:
Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones,
and give thanks to his holy fame.
30.5:
For there is a moment in his anger;
there is a lifetime in his favor.
Weeping lodges for the evening,
but in the morning comes rejoicing.
30.6:
But as for me, I had said in my prosperity,
“I shall not be moved ever.”
30.7:
O Yahweh, by your favor
you caused my strong mountain to stand.
You hid your face. I was bewildered.
30.8:
To you, O Yahweh, I called,
and to the Lord I pleaded for grace saying,
30.9:
“What gain is there in my death,
in my going down into the pit?
Will the dust praise you?
Will it tell of your faithfulness?
30.10:
“O Yahweh, hear and be gracious to me.
O Yahweh, be my helper.”
30.11:
You have turned my wailing into my dancing.
You have removed my sackcloth
and clothed me with joy
30.12:
so that I may sing praises to you
and not be quiet.
O Yahweh, my God,
I will give thanks to you forever.

31.1:
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge.
Let me not be put to shame ever.
Deliver me by your righteousness.
31.2:
Incline your ear to me.
Quickly deliver me.
Become my rock of refuge,
a fortified keep to save me.
31.3:
For you are my rock and my fortress.
So, for the sake of your name,
lead me and guide me.
31.4:
Bring me out of the net that they have secretly set for me,
for you are my refuge.
31.5:
Into your hand I commit my spirit.
You have redeemed me, O Yahweh, faithful God.
31.6:
I hate those devoted to useless idols,
but I trust Yahweh.
31.7:
I will exult and rejoice in your loyal love.
Because you have seen my misery,
you know the distresses of my life.
31.8:
And you have not delivered me
into the hand of the enemy.
You have set my feet in a broad place.
31.9:
Be gracious to me, O Yahweh,
because I have distress.
My eye wastes away because of vexation,
along with my soul and my body.
31.10:
For my life is at an end with sorrow,
and my years with sighing.
My strength stumbles because of my iniquity,
and my bones waste away.
31.11:
Because of all my adversaries I have become a disgrace,
especially to my neighbors,
and a dread to my acquaintances.
Those who see me in the street flee from me.
31.12:
I have become forgotten like one dead, out of mind.
I am like a destroyed vessel.
31.13:
For I hear the rumor of many,
“Terror on every side!”
When conspiring together against me,
they have plotted to take my life.
31.14:
But as for me, I trust you, O Yahweh.
I say, “You are my God.”
31.15:
My times are in your hand.
Deliver me from the hand of my enemies
and from those who pursue me.
31.16:
Shine your face upon your servant.
Save me by your loyal love.
31.17:
O Yahweh, let me not be put to shame, for I call on you.
Let the wicked be put to shame.
Let them go silently to Sheol.
31.18:
Let lying lips be dumb,
that speak against the righteous unrestrained
with arrogance and contempt.
31.19:
How abundant is your goodness
that you have stored up for those who fear you,
that you perform for those who take refuge in you
before the children of humankind.
31.20:
You will hide them in the protection of your presence
from the plots of man.
You will hide them in a shelter from the strife of tongues.
31.21:
Blessed is Yahweh,
because he has worked marvelously his loyal love to me
in a besieged city.
31.22:
As for me, I said in my alarm,
“I am cut off from before your eyes.”
However you heard the voice of my supplications
when I cried to you for help.
31.23:
Love Yahweh, all you his faithful ones.
Yahweh preserves the faithful
but repays abundantly the one who acts arrogantly.
31.24:
Be strong and let your heart show strength,
all you who wait for Yahweh.

32.1:
Happy is he whose transgression is taken away,
whose sin is covered.
32.2:
Happy is a person to whom Yahweh does not impute iniquity
and in whose spirit there is not deceit.
32.3:
When I kept silent, my bones were worn out
due to my groaning all the day.
32.4:
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me.
My vigor was changed into the dry heat of summer. Selah
32.5:
I made known my sin to you, and my iniquity I did not cover.
I said, “I will confess concerning my transgressions to Yahweh,”
and you took away the guilt of my sin. Selah
32.6:
Therefore let all the faithful pray to you
at the time for finding you.
Surely at the flood of many waters they will not reach him.
32.8:
I will instruct you and teach you
in the way that you should go.
I will advise you with my eye upon you.
32.10:
Many are the pains of the wicked,
but for the one who trusts Yahweh
loyal love surrounds him.
32.11:
Be glad in Yahweh and rejoice, you righteous,
and shout for joy, all you upright of heart.

33.1:
Exult in Yahweh, O you righteous,
for praise is fitting for the upright.
33.2:
Give thanks to Yahweh with the lyre;
with a harp of ten strings play to him.
33.3:
Sing to him a new song;
play skillfully with jubilant shout.
33.4:
For the word of Yahweh is upright,
and all his work is done in faithfulness.
33.5:
He loves righteousness and justice.
The earth is full of the loyal love of Yahweh.
33.6:
By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made,
and by the breath of his mouth all their host.
33.7:
He gathered the waters of the sea like a heap.
He put the deeps in storehouses.
33.8:
Let all the earth fear Yahweh.
Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
33.9:
For he himself spoke and it came to pass.
He himself commanded and it stood firm.
33.10:
Yahweh brings to nothing the plan of nations;
he frustrates the intents of peoples.
33.11:
The plan of Yahweh stands firm forever,
the intents of his heart from one generation to the next.
33.12:
Blessed is the nation whose God is Yahweh,
the people he has chosen for his inheritance.
33.13:
From heaven Yahweh looks;
he sees all the children of humankind.
33.14:
From his dwelling place he gazes
on all the inhabitants of the earth,
33.15:
he who fashions altogether their heart,
he who understands all their works.
33.16:
The king is not saved by the greatness of an army.
The warrior is not delivered by the greatness of strength.
33.17:
The horse is a false hope for victory,
nor can it save by the greatness of its power.
33.18:
Behold, the eye of Yahweh is on those who fear him,
on those who hope for his loyal love
33.19:
to deliver their soul from death
and to keep them alive in famine.
33.20:
Our soul waits for Yahweh;
he is our help and our shield.
33.21:
For in him our heart rejoices
because in his holy name we trust.
33.22:
Let your loyal love, O Yahweh, be upon us,
even as we hope in you.

34.1:
I will bless Yahweh at all times;
his praise shall be in my mouth continually.
34.2:
My soul makes its boast in Yahweh;
let the humble hear and be glad.
34.3:
Magnify Yahweh with me,
and let us exalt his name together.
34.4:
I sought Yahweh and he answered me,
and from all my terrors he delivered me.
34.5:
They looked to him and were radiant,
and their faces shall not be ashamed.
34.6:
This poor man called and Yahweh heard,
and saved him from all his troubles.
34.7:
The angel of Yahweh encamps
around those who fear him,
and he rescues them.
34.8:
Taste and see that Yahweh is good;
blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.
34.9:
Fear Yahweh, you his saints,
for there is no lack for those who fear him.
34.10:
The young lions are in want and suffer hunger,
but those who seek Yahweh will not lack for any good thing.
34.11:
Come, you children, listen to me;
I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.
34.12:
Who is the man who desires life,
who loves many days in order to see good?
34.13:
Keep your tongue from evil
and your lips from speaking deceit.
34.14:
Turn from evil and do good.
Seek peace and pursue it.
34.15:
The eyes of Yahweh are toward the righteous,
and his ears toward their cry for help.
34.16:
The face of Yahweh is against evildoers,
to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
34.17:
They cry out and Yahweh hears
and delivers them from all of their troubles.
34.18:
Yahweh is near to those who are heartbroken
and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
34.19:
Many are the distresses of the righteous,
but Yahweh delivers him out of them all.
34.20:
He protects all his bones;
not one of them is broken.
34.21:
Evil will slay the wicked,
and those who hate the righteous will incur guilt.
34.22:
Yahweh redeems the life of his servants,
and none who take refuge in him will incur guilt.

35.1:
Contend, O Yahweh, with my contenders;
fight those who fight me.
35.2:
Grasp buckler and shield
and rise to my aid.
35.3:
And draw the spear and javelin to meet those who pursue me.
Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
35.4:
Let those who seek my life be shamed and humiliated.
Let those who plot calamity against me be repulsed and ashamed.
35.5:
Let them be like chaff before the wind,
with the angel of Yahweh driving them.
35.6:
Let their way be dark and slippery,
with the angel of Yahweh pursuing them.
35.7:
For without cause they secretly hide the pit with their net for me;
without cause they dug it for my life.
35.8:
Let unforeseen ruin come on him,
and his net that he hid, let it catch him.
Let him fall into it in ruin.
35.9:
Then my soul will rejoice in Yahweh;
it will rejoice in his salvation.
35.10:
All of my bones shall say, “O Yahweh, who is like you,
who delivers the poor from one stronger than he
and the poor and needy from the one who robs him?”
35.11:
Violent witnesses rise up;
they ask me concerning what I do not know.
35.12:
They repay me evil in place of good.
It is bereavement to my soul.
35.13:
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth.
I weakened my soul with fasting,
and my prayer returned to me unanswered.
35.14:
I behaved as though he were a friend or as a brother to me.
As one lamenting a mother, I was bowed down in mourning.
35.16:
Among the ungodly of the mockers at feasts,
they gnashed at me with their teeth.
35.17:
My Lord, how long will you watch?
Restore my life from their ravages,
my only life from the young lions.
35.18:
I will give thanks to you in the great assembly;
among the mighty people I will praise you.
35.19:
Let not those who are wrongfully my enemies rejoice over me.
Nor let those who hate me without cause wink the eye.
35.20:
For they do not speak peace,
but against the quiet ones of the land
they plan deceitful words.
35.21:
They also made wide their mouths against me.
They said, “Aha! Aha!
Our eyes have seen it.”
35.22:
You have seen, O Yahweh. Do not be deaf.
O Lord, do not be far from me.
35.23:
Wake up and rouse yourself for my right,
for my cause, O my God and my Lord.
35.24:
Vindicate me according to your righteousness,
O Yahweh my God,
and do not let them rejoice over me.
35.25:
Do not let them say in their hearts, “Aha, our desire.”
Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
35.26:
Let them be shamed and abashed altogether,
who rejoice at my misfortune.
Let them put on shame and insult,
who magnify themselves against me.
35.27:
Let them shout for joy and be glad,
who delight in my vindication;
and let them say continually, “Yahweh is great,
who delights in the welfare of his servant.”
35.28:
Then my tongue will proclaim your righteousness,
and your praise all day.

36.1:
An oracle: the wicked has rebellion
in the midst of his heart.
There is no fear of God before his eyes.
36.2:
For he flatters himself in his eyes,
hating to detect his iniquity.
36.3:
The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit.
He has ceased to have insight and to do good.
36.4:
He plans sin on his bed.
He puts himself on a way that is not good.
He does not reject evil.
36.5:
O Yahweh, your loyal love extends into the heavens,
your faithfulness unto the clouds.
36.6:
Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains,
your judgments like the great deep.
You save man and beast, O Yahweh.
36.7:
How precious is your loyal love, O God,
and the children of humankind
take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
36.8:
They are refreshed with the fullness of your house,
and you give them drink from the river of your delights.
36.9:
For with you is the fountain of life;
in your light we see light.
36.10:
Prolong your loyal love to those who know you,
and your righteousness to the upright of heart.
36.11:
Do not let a foot of pride come against me,
nor let a wicked hand make me to wander homeless.
36.12:
There doers of evil have fallen;
they are thrust down and not able to rise.

37.1:
Do not fret because of evildoers;
do not be envious of doers of wickedness.
37.2:
For like the grass they will dry up quickly,
and like green vegetation they will wither.
37.3:
Trust Yahweh and do good.
Abide in the land and feed on faithfulness.
37.4:
Take pleasure in Yahweh as well,
and he will give to you the requests of your heart.
37.5:
Commit to Yahweh your way;
Trust also on him and he will act.
37.6:
Then he will bring forth your righteousness like the light,
and your justice like the noonday.
37.7:
Be quiet before Yahweh and wait for him.
Do not fret about one who succeeds in his way,
about a man making plots.
37.8:
Refrain from anger and forsake wrath.
Do not fret; it only brings evil.
37.9:
For evildoers will be cut off,
but those who wait for Yahweh—
they will possess the land.
37.10:
And yet a little while and the wicked will not be,
and you will look carefully upon his place, but he will not be.
37.11:
But the afflicted will possess the land,
and they will take pleasure in an abundance of peace.
37.12:
The wicked plans evil against the righteous,
and gnashes at him with his teeth.
37.13:
The Lord laughs at him,
for he sees that his day is coming.
37.14:
The wicked have drawn the sword and have bent their bow
to throw down the poor and the needy,
to kill those upright in their way.
37.15:
Their sword will enter into their own heart,
and their bows shall be broken.
37.16:
The little belonging to the righteous is better
than the wealth of many wicked.
37.17:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
but Yahweh supports the righteous.
37.18:
Yahweh knows the days of the blameless,
and their inheritance will be forever.
37.19:
They will not be put to shame in distressing times,
and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.
37.20:
But the wicked will perish,
and the enemies of Yahweh will be like the splendor of the pastures.
They vanish; in smoke they vanish.
37.21:
The wicked borrows and does not repay,
but the righteous is gracious and gives.
37.22:
For those blessed by him shall possess the land,
but those cursed by him shall be cut off.
37.23:
The steps of a man are established by Yahweh,
and he takes pleasure in his way.
37.24:
Though he fall, he will not be cast headlong,
for Yahweh supports him with his hand.
37.26:
All the day he is gracious and lends,
and his children are a blessing.
37.27:
Turn aside from evil and do good
and so abide forever.
37.28:
For Yahweh loves justice
and will not forsake his faithful ones.
They are protected forever.
But the children of the wicked will be cut off.
37.29:
The righteous will possess the land
and abide in it forever.
37.30:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
and his tongue speaks justice.
37.31:
The law of his God is in his heart.
His steps will not slip.
37.32:
The wicked watches for the righteous
and seeks to kill him.
37.33:
Yahweh will not abandon him into his hand,
and he will not let him be condemned when he is judged.
37.34:
Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,
and he will exalt you to possess the land.
When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
37.35:
I have seen the wicked acting violently
and spreading himself out
like a luxuriant native tree.
37.36:
Then he passed on and behold, he was not.
And I sought him, but he could not be found.
37.37:
Observe the blameless and look at the upright,
for there is a future for a man of peace.
37.38:
But transgressors shall be destroyed altogether.
The future of the wicked shall be cut off.
37.39:
And the salvation of the righteous is from Yahweh,
their refuge in the time of trouble.
37.40:
And Yahweh helps them and he rescues them.
He rescues them from the wicked and saves them,
because they take refuge in him.

38.1:
O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger
or chastise me in your wrath.
38.2:
For your arrows have sunk into me,
and your hand has pressed down on me.
38.3:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation.
There is no health in my bones because of my sin.
38.4:
For my iniquities have passed over my head;
like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
38.5:
My wounds start to stink; they rot
because of my foolishness.
38.6:
I am bowed down; I am bent over greatly.
All the day I go about mourning.
38.7:
For my loins are full of burning,
and there is no soundness in my flesh.
38.8:
I am faint and crushed greatly;
I groan because of the roaring of my heart.
38.9:
O Lord, all my longing is before you,
and my sighing is not hidden from you.
38.10:
My heart throbs violently, my strength leaves me;
and the light of my eyes, that also is not with me.
38.11:
My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction,
and my relatives stand afar off.
38.12:
Those who seek my life lay snares as well,
and those intent on my harm speak threats.
They also plot deceit all day.
38.13:
But as for me, like the deaf I cannot hear,
and I am like the mute who cannot open his mouth.
38.14:
And so I am like a man who hears not,
and in whose mouth there are no retorts.
38.15:
Rather for you I wait, O Yahweh.
You will answer, O Lord my God.
38.16:
For I said, “Help, lest they rejoice over me,
lest they boast against me when my foot slips.”
38.17:
For I am ready to stumble,
and my pain is before me continually.
38.18:
For my iniquity I confess;
I am anxious because of my sin.
38.19:
And my enemies without cause are numerous,
and those who hate me wrongfully are many.
38.20:
And those who repay evil in return for good
accuse me in return for my pursuing good.
38.21:
Do not forsake me, O Yahweh.
O my God, do not be far from me.
38.22:
Hurry to help me,
O Lord, my salvation.

39.1:
I said, “I will guard my ways
that I may not sin with my tongue.
I will keep a muzzle over my mouth
as long as the wicked are before me.”
39.2:
I was mute with silence. I was silent even from saying good things,
and my pain was stirred up.
39.4:
“Let me know, O Yahweh, my end,
and what is the measure of my days.
Let me know how transient I am.”
39.5:
Look, you have made my days mere handbreadths,
and my lifespan as nothing next to you.
Surely every person standing firm is complete vanity. Selah
39.7:
And now, O Lord, for what do I wait?
My hope is for you.
39.8:
From all my transgressions deliver me;
do not make me the taunt of the fool.
39.9:
I am mute. I do not open my mouth,
for you, yourself, have done it.
39.10:
Remove from me your affliction.
By the opposition of your hand I perish.
39.11:
When with rebukes you chastise a man for sin,
you consume like a moth his delightful things.
Surely everyone is a mere vapor. Selah
39.12:
Hear my prayer, O Yahweh, and listen to my cry for help;
do not be deaf to my tears.
For I am an alien with you,
a sojourner like all my ancestors.
39.13:
Look away from me that I may be cheerful,
before I depart and I am no more.

40.1:
I waited patiently for Yahweh,
And he inclined to me
and heard my cry for help.
40.2:
And so he brought me up from the roaring pit,
from the miry clay.
And he put my feet upon a rock;
he made my steps steady.
40.3:
Then he put a new song in my mouth,
a praise to our God.
Many will see and fear,
and will trust Yahweh.
40.4:
Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust
and does not turn to the proud and to those who fall away to a lie.
40.5:
Many things, O Yahweh my God, you have done—
your wonderful deeds and your thoughts toward us.
There is none to compare with you.
If I tried to proclaim and tell of them,
they would be too numerous to count.
40.6:
A sacrifice and offering you do not desire.
My ears you have opened.
Burnt offering and sin offering you have not demanded.
40.7:
Then I said, “Look, I come.
In the scroll of the book
it is written concerning me:
40.8:
‘I delight to do your will, O my God,
and your law is deep within me.’”
40.9:
I have brought good tidings of righteousness in the great congregation.
Look, I have not shut my lips.
O Yahweh, you surely know that.
40.10:
Your righteousness I have not hidden in the midst of my heart.
I have spoken of your faithfulness and your salvation.
I have not concealed your loyal love or your faithfulness
from the great congregation.
40.11:
As for you, O Yahweh, do not withhold your mercies from me.
Let your loyal love and your faithfulness
continually preserve me.
40.12:
For evils without number have encompassed me.
My iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to see.
They are more than the hairs of my head,
and my heart fails me.
40.13:
Be pleased, O Yahweh, to deliver me.
O Yahweh, hurry to help me.
40.14:
Let them be shamed and abashed altogether
who seek to take away my life.
Let them be repulsed and humiliated
who desire my harm.
40.15:
Let them be appalled because of their shame,
those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!”
40.16:
Let them rejoice and be glad in you,
all those who seek you.
Let them say continually, “Yahweh is great!”
—those who love your salvation.
40.17:
But I am poor and needy.
Let my Lord consider me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O my God, do not delay.

41.1:
Blessed is the one who has regard for the poor;
in the day of disaster, Yahweh delivers him.
41.2:
Yahweh protects him and keeps him alive;
he is blessed in the land,
and you do not give him
into the will of his enemies.
41.3:
Yahweh sustains him on his sick bed.
In his illness, you restore to health.
41.4:
As for me, I said, “O Yahweh, be gracious to me.
Heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
41.5:
My enemies speak evil about me,
“When will he die and his name perish?”
41.7:
All who hate me speak together against me.
Against me they assume the worst for me:
41.8:
“A ruinous thing is poured out on him,
and now that he lies down, he will not rise up again.”
41.9:
Even my close friend, whom I trusted,
who ate my bread,
has lifted his heel against me.
41.10:
But you, O Yahweh, be gracious to me and raise me up
that I may repay them.
41.11:
By this I know that you delight in me:
because my enemy has not shouted in triumph over me.
41.12:
As for me, you have upheld me in my integrity,
and you have set me in your presence forever.
41.13:
Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel,
from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.

42.1:
As a deer longs for streams of water,
so my soul longs for you, O God.
42.2:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
When shall I come and appear before God?
42.4:
These I remember and I pour out my soul within me:
that I would go with the multitude;
I led them in procession to the house of God,
with a voice of rejoicing and thanksgiving,
a crowd celebrating a festival.
42.5:
Why are you in despair, O my soul,
and disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I will again praise him,
for the salvation of his presence.
42.7:
Deep is calling to deep
at the thunder of your waterfalls.
All your breakers and your waves
have passed over me.
42.8:
By day Yahweh commands his loyal love,
and in the night his song is with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.
42.9:
I say to God, my rock,
“Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I walk about mourning
because of the oppression of the enemy?”
42.10:
As with a shattering in my bones
my oppressors taunt me,
while they say to me all day,
“Where is your God?”
42.11:
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I shall again praise him,
my salvation and my God.

43.1:
Judge me, O God, and plead my case
against an unfaithful nation.
From a man of deceit and wickedness rescue me,
43.2:
because you are the God of my refuge.
Why have you rejected me?
Why must I go about mourning
because of the oppression of the enemy?
43.3:
Send your light and your truth;
they shall lead me.
They shall bring me to your holy mountain
and to your dwelling places.
43.4:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
to God, my surpassing joy,
and I will praise you with lyre,
O God, my God.
43.5:
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I will again praise him,
my salvation and my God.

44.1:
O God, we have heard with our ears;
our ancestors have told us
of work you worked in their days,
in days of old.
44.2:
You with your hand drove out the nations,
but them you planted.
You harmed the peoples,
but them you let spread out.
44.3:
For not with their sword
did they possess the land,
and their arm did not give them victory.
Rather it was your right hand and your arm
and the light of your presence,
because you delighted in them.
44.4:
You are my king, O God.
Command victories for Jacob.
44.5:
By you we push down our enemies;
by your name we tread down those who rise up against us.
44.6:
For I do not trust my bow,
and my sword cannot give me victory.
44.7:
Rather you have saved us from our enemies,
and have humiliated those who hate us.
44.8:
In God we boast all the day,
and we will give thanks to your name forever. Selah
44.9:
Surely you have rejected and disgraced us,
and have not gone out with our armies.
44.10:
You have caused us to pull back from the enemy,
and so those who hate us have plundered for themselves.
44.11:
You have given us as sheep for food,
and among the nations you have scattered us.
44.12:
You have sold your people cheaply,
and did not profit by their price.
44.13:
You have made us a taunt to our neighbors,
a derision and a scorn to those around us.
44.14:
You have made us a byword among the nations,
a shaking of the head among the peoples.
44.15:
All day long my disgrace is before me,
and the shame of my face covers me,
44.16:
because of the voice of the taunter and the reviler,
because of the enemy and the avenger.
44.17:
All this has befallen us, though we have not forgotten you,
and we have not been false to your covenant.
44.18:
Our heart has not turned back,
and our steps have not turned aside from your way.
44.19:
But you have crushed us in a place of jackals,
and have covered us with deep shadow.
44.20:
If we had forgotten the name of our God,
or had spread out our hands in prayer to a foreign god,
44.21:
would not God discover this,
for he knows the secrets of the heart?
44.22:
Rather, on account of you we are killed all day long;
we are accounted as sheep for slaughter.
44.23:
Wake up! Why do you sleep, O Lord?
Awake! Do not reject forever.
44.24:
Why do you hide your face?
Have you forgotten our misery and our oppression?
44.25:
For our soul is bowed down to the dust.
Our body clings to the ground.
44.26:
Rise up! Be a help for us,
and redeem us for the sake of your loyal love.

45.3:
Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
in your splendor and your majesty.
45.4:
And in your majesty ride victoriously,
because of truth and humility and righteousness.
And let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.
45.6:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
A scepter of uprightness is
the scepter of your kingdom.
45.7:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
Therefore God, your God, has anointed you
from among your companions with festive oil.
45.8:
All your robes are scented with myrrh and aloes and cassia.
From palaces of ivory stringed instruments gladden you.
45.9:
Kings’ daughters are among your noble ladies.
The queen stands at your right hand in gold of Ophir.
45.10:
Hear, O daughter, and discern and incline your ear,
and forget your people and your father’s house.
45.11:
Let the king desire your beauty.
Because he is your lord, therefore bow down to him.
45.12:
Even the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift.
The rich from among people will seek your favor.
45.13:
The king’s daughter is all glorious within;
her garment is of gold embroidered cloth.
45.14:
She is brought to the king in colorful garments.
The young women behind her, her attendants,
are being brought to you.
45.15:
They are led with joy and gladness.
They enter the palace of the king.
45.16:
In place of your fathers will be your sons.
You will make them princes in all the land.
45.17:
I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.

46.1:
God is our refuge and strength,
a very sufficient help in troubles.
46.2:
Therefore we will not fear though the earth change,
and though the mountains totter into the midst of the sea,
46.3:
though its waters roar and foam,
though mountains shake with its surging water. Selah
46.4:
There is a river whose streams gladden the city of God,
the holiest of the dwellings of the Most High.
46.6:
Nations roar, kingdoms shake;
he utters his voice, the earth melts.
46.7:
Yahweh of hosts is with us;
our high stronghold is the God of Jacob. Selah
46.8:
Come, see the works of Yahweh,
who has placed desolations on the earth.
46.11:
Yahweh of Hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our high stronghold.

47.1:
All you peoples, clap your hands.
Shout to God with a voice of rejoicing.
47.2:
For Yahweh Most High is awesome,
a great king over all the earth.
47.3:
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
47.4:
He chooses for us our inheritance,
the pride of Jacob whom he loves.
47.5:
God has gone up with a shout,
Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.
47.6:
Sing praises to God, sing praises.
Sing praises to our king, sing praises.
47.7:
For God is king of all the earth.
Sing praises with understanding.
47.8:
God reigns over nations;
God sits on his holy throne.
47.9:
The princes of the peoples are gathered together
with the people of Abraham’s God.
For the shields of the earth belong to God.
He is very exalted.

48.1:
Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise
in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.
48.2:
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
is Mount Zion, in the far north,
the city of the great king.
48.3:
God is in her citadels;
he is known as a high stronghold.
48.4:
For see, the kings assembled;
they advanced together.
48.5:
They themselves saw it, so they were astonished.
They were terrified; they ran off.
48.6:
Trembling seized them there—
pain as of a woman in labor.
48.7:
With an east wind
you shatter the ships of Tarshish.
48.8:
As we have heard, so we have seen
in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God.
God will establish her forever. Selah
48.9:
We have pondered your loyal love, O God,
in the midst of your temple.
48.10:
As is your name, O God, so is your praise
to the ends of the earth.
Your right hand is full of righteousness.
48.12:
Walk about Zion and circle it;
count her towers.
48.13:
Consider well her ramparts.
Go through her citadels
so that you can tell the next generation
48.14:
that this is God, our God forever and ever.
He himself will guide us until death.

49.1:
Hear this, all you peoples;
give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,
49.2:
both low and high,
rich and poor together.
49.3:
My mouth will speak wisdom,
and the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
49.4:
I will incline my ear to a proverb;
I will propound my riddle on a lyre.
49.5:
Why should I fear in times of calamity,
when iniquity surrounds me at my heels,
49.6:
those who trust their wealth
and boast about the abundance of their riches?
49.7:
Surely a man cannot redeem a brother.
He cannot give to God his ransom
49.8:
(since the redemption price for their life is costly
and it always fails),
49.9:
so that he may stay alive forever
and not see the pit.
49.10:
For he sees that the wise die,
together with the fool and brute they perish,
and leave their wealth to the next generation.
49.11:
Within them they think their houses are forever,
their dwelling places from generation to generation.
They name their lands by their own names.
49.12:
But man cannot continue in his pomp.
He is like the beasts that perish.
49.13:
This is the journey of those who have foolish confidence,
and those after them who accept their sayings. Selah
49.14:
Like sheep they are destined to Sheol;
death will shepherd them.
But the upright will rule over them in the morning,
and their forms will be for Sheol to consume,
far from his lofty abode.
49.16:
Do not fear when a man becomes rich,
when the wealth of his house increases,
49.17:
because when he dies he will not take away any of it.
His wealth will not follow down after him.
49.18:
Though he congratulated his soul while he was living
—and people will praise you when you do well for yourself—
49.19:
it will go to the generation of his fathers.
Never will they see light.
49.20:
Humankind in its pomp, but does not understand,
is like the beasts that perish.

50.1:
The Supreme God, God, Yahweh, has spoken
and summoned the earth,
from the rising of the sun
to its setting.
50.2:
From Zion, the perfection of beauty,
God shines forth.
50.3:
Our God comes and he is not silent.
Before him fire devours,
and around him it is very tempestuous.
50.4:
He summons the heavens above
and the earth that he might judge his people:
50.5:
“Gather to me my loyal ones,
those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
50.6:
And the heavens declare his righteousness,
because God himself is judge. Selah
50.7:
“Hear, O my people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will testify against you.
I am God, your God.
50.8:
It is not concerning a lack of your sacrifices that I rebuke you,
and your burnt offerings are before me continually.
50.9:
I will not take from your house a bull
or from your stalls a he-goat,
50.10:
because every animal of the forest is mine,
the cattle on a thousand hills.
50.11:
I know every bird of the mountains,
and every moving creature in the field is mine.
50.12:
If I were hungry I would not tell you,
because the world and its fullness are mine.
50.13:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls
or drink the blood of goats?
50.14:
Offer to God a thank offering
and pay your vows to the Most High.
50.15:
And call me in the day of trouble;
I will deliver you, and you will glorify me.”
50.16:
But to the wicked God says,
“What right have you to recite my statutes
and mention my covenant with your mouth,
50.17:
while you yourself hate discipline,
and cast my words behind you?
50.18:
When you see a thief, then you are pleased with him,
and your association is with adulterers.
50.19:
You give your mouth free rein for evil,
and you harness your tongue to deceit.
50.20:
You sit and speak against your brother;
you slander your mother’s son.
50.22:
Now consider this, you who forget God,
lest I tear you apart, and there will be none to deliver.

51.1:
Be gracious to me, O God, according to your loyal love.
According to your abundant mercies,
blot out my transgressions.
51.2:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
and from my sin cleanse me.
51.3:
For I myself know my transgressions,
and my sin is ever before me.
51.4:
Against you, only you, I have sinned
and have done this evil in your eyes,
so that you are correct when you speak,
you are blameless when you judge.
51.5:
Behold, in iniquity I was born,
and in sin my mother conceived me.
51.6:
Behold, you delight in truth in the inward parts,
and in the hidden parts you make me to know wisdom.
51.7:
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean.
Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
51.8:
Make me hear joy and gladness;
let the bones you have crushed rejoice.
51.9:
Hide your face from my sins,
and all my iniquities blot out.
51.10:
Create a clean heart for me, O God,
and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
51.11:
Do not cast me away from your presence,
and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
51.12:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
and with a willing spirit sustain me.
51.13:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
and sinners will turn back to you.
51.15:
O Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will proclaim your praise.
51.16:
For you do not delight in sacrifice or I would give it.
With a burnt offering you are not pleased.
51.18:
Do good in your favor toward Zion.
Build the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19:
Then you will delight in righteous sacrifices,
burnt offering and whole burnt offering.
Then bulls will be offered on your altar.

52.1:
Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man?
The loyal love of God endures continually.
52.2:
Your tongue plans destruction,
like a sharp razor, working deceit.
52.3:
You love evil more than good,
a lie more than speaking what is right. Selah
52.4:
You love all devouring words,
O deceitful tongue,
52.5:
but God will pull you down forever.
He will snatch you and tear you away from your tent,
and he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
52.6:
And the righteous will see and fear,
and will laugh at him, saying,
52.8:
But I am like an olive tree flourishing
in the house of God.
I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.
52.9:
I will give thanks to you forever, because of what you have done,
and I will wait on your name, because it is good,
in the presence of your faithful ones.

53.1:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt and they have done abominable iniquity.
There is none who does good.
53.2:
God looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind
to see whether there is one who has insight,
one who seeks God.
53.3:
All of them have turned back.
They are altogether corrupt.
There is none who does good;
there is not even one.
53.4:
Do not evildoers know,
they who eat my people as though they were eating bread?
They do not call on God.
53.5:
There they are very fearful
where no fear had been,
because God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you.
You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
53.6:
Oh, that from Zion would come salvation for Israel!
When God returns the fortunes of his people,
let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

54.1:
O God, by your name save me,
and by your power vindicate me.
54.2:
O God, hear my prayer;
heed the words of my mouth.
54.3:
For foreigners have risen against me,
and ruthless men seek my life.
They have not set God before them. Selah
54.4:
See, God is my helper;
The Lord is with those who sustain my life.
54.5:
He will repay my enemies for their evil;
in your faithfulness destroy them.
54.7:
Because he has delivered me from all trouble,
and my eye has looked with satisfaction on my enemies.

55.1:
Give ear, O God, to my prayer,
and do not hide yourself from my plea.
55.2:
Attend to me and answer me.
I am restless in my lamenting and I groan,
55.3:
because of the voice of an enemy,
because of the oppression of the wicked,
because they bring down evil on me,
and in anger they hold a grudge against me.
55.4:
My heart trembles within me,
and deathly terrors fall on me.
55.5:
Fear and trembling come on me,
and horror overwhelms me.
55.6:
So I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove.
I would fly away and be at rest.
55.7:
Look, I would flee far away.
I would dwell in the wilderness. Selah
55.8:
I would hurry to my refuge
from the raging wind and storm.”
55.9:
Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech,
because I see violence and strife in the city.
55.10:
Day and night they go around it on its walls,
and iniquity and trouble are in its midst.
55.11:
Destruction is within it,
and oppression and deceit
do not depart from its public square.
55.12:
For it is not an enemy that taunts me,
or I could bear it.
It is not one who hates me that magnifies himself over me,
or I could hide myself from him.
55.13:
But it is you, a man my equal,
my friend and confidant.
55.15:
Let death deceive them. May they descend to Sheol alive,
because evil is in their home and heart.
55.16:
As for me, I will call to God,
and Yahweh will save me.
55.17:
Morning, noon and night I will lament and groan loudly,
and he will hear my voice.
55.18:
He safely redeems my life from the battle against me,
because those standing against me are among many.
55.19:
God will hear and answer them,
he who is enthroned from of old, Selah
Because they do not change,
and they do not fear God.
55.20:
He has put forth his hands against his friends;
he has defiled his covenant.
55.21:
The buttery words of his mouth were smooth,
but there was battle in his heart.
His words were smoother than oil,
but they were drawn swords.
55.22:
Cast your burden on Yahweh,
and he will sustain you.
He will never allow the righteous to be moved.
55.23:
But you, O God, you will bring them down to the pit of corruption.
The men of bloodshed and deceit will not live half their days,
but I will trust you.

56.1:
Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me;
fighting all the day he oppresses me.
56.2:
My enemies trample all day,
because many are attacking me proudly.
56.3: When I fear, I trust you.
56.4:
God, whose word I praise,
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can mere flesh do to me?
56.5:
All day they twist my words;
all their thoughts are against me for evil.
56.6:
They attack, they hide, they watch my steps,
as they lie in wait for my life.
56.7:
Because of iniquity will they escape?
In anger cast down the peoples, O God.
56.9:
Then my enemies will turn back when I call.
This I know because God is for me.
56.10:
God, whose word I praise,
Yahweh, whose word I praise,
56.11:
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can mere humankind do to me?
56.12:
My vows to you, O God, are binding upon me.
I will pay thank offerings to you,
56.13:
because you have delivered my soul from death.
Have you not kept my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before God
in the light of the living?

57.1:
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me,
because in you my soul takes refuge.
In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge
until destruction passes by.
57.2:
I will call to God Most High,
to God who accomplishes things concerning me.
57.4:
My soul is among lions.
I lie down among those who devour—
the children of humankind whose teeth are spears and arrows
and whose tongues are sharp swords.
57.5:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be above all the earth.
57.9:
I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord;
I will give you praise among the nations.
57.10:
Because your loyal love is high to the heavens,
and your faithfulness to the clouds.
57.11:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be above all the earth.

58.1:
Do you really speak what is right when silent?
Do you judge fairly the children of humankind?
58.2:
No, in your heart you plan injustices;
in the land you weigh out the violence of your hands.
58.3:
The wicked are estranged from the womb.
They go astray from the belly, speaking lies.
58.4:
Their venom is like snake venom;
They are like a deaf viper that closes its ear
58.5:
so that it does not hear the voice of charmers
or the skilled caster of spells.
58.6:
O God, break their teeth in their mouth.
Break off the fangs of the young lions, O Yahweh.
58.7:
Let them run away like water that runs off.
When he bends the bow, let his arrows be as though they were cut off.
58.8:
Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes;
like the stillborn of woman that do not see the sun.
58.9:
Before your pots can feel the heat of a thornbush,
whether green or dry, he will sweep it away.
58.10:
The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance;
he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
58.11:
And people will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous.
Surely there is a God who judges in the land.”

59.1:
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God.
Protect me from those who rise up against me.
59.2:
Deliver me from workers of iniquity,
and from men of bloodshed save me.
59.3:
For look, they lie in wait for my life.
The mighty attack against me,
not because of my transgression or my sin, O Yahweh.
59.4:
Without guilt on my part they run and ready themselves.
Awake to meet me and see.
59.5:
And you, Yahweh, God of hosts, are the God of Israel.
Rouse yourself to punish all the nations.
Do not be gracious to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah
59.6:
They return at evening; they howl like dogs
while they prowl the city.
59.7:
Look, they pour out talk with their mouth.
Swords are on their lips,
for they say, “Who hears?”
59.8:
But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them;
you will mock all the nations.
59.9:
O my strength, I will watch for you,
because you, O God, are my (high) stronghold.
59.10:
My God of loyal love will meet me;
God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.
59.11:
Do not kill them, lest my people forget.
Make them to wander by your power,
and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
59.12:
By the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips,
even in their pride, let them be trapped,
and for the curses and lies they proclaim.
59.13:
Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more,
so that they may know that God is ruling in Jacob
to the ends of the earth. Selah
59.14:
They return at evening; they howl like dogs
while they prowl the city.
59.15:
As for them, they wander for food.
If they are not satisfied, then they continue all night.
59.16:
But as for me, I will sing of your strength,
and I will hail your loyal love in the morning,
because you have been my high stronghold
and a refuge in my time of trouble.
59.17:
O my strength, to you I will give praise,
because God is my high stronghold,
my God of loyal love.

60.1:
O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us.
You have been angry. Restore us!
60.2:
You have made the land quake. You have split it open.
Heal its fissures, because it totters.
60.3:
You have shown your people hard things;
