You have given us wine that staggers.
60.4:
You have rallied those who fear you round a banner
out of bowshot, Selah
60.5:
so that your beloved ones may be rescued.
Save by your right hand and answer us.
60.6:
God has spoken in his holiness,
“I will rejoice;
I will divide up Shechem,
and portion out the valley of Succoth.
60.9:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
60.10:
Have not you yourself rejected us, O God,
and not gone out with our armies, O God?
60.11:
Give us help against the adversary,
for the help of humankind is futile.
60.12:
Through God we will do valiantly,
and it is he who will tread down our enemies.

61.1:
Hear, O God, my cry;
attend to my prayer.
61.2:
From the end of the earth I call to you
when my heart grows faint.
You will lead me to a rock that is higher than I.
61.3:
For you have been my refuge,
a strong tower from the enemy.
61.4:
Let me reside in your tent forever.
Let me take refuge under the covering of your wings. Selah
61.5:
For you, O God, you have heard my vows.
You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
61.6:
You will add days to the days of the king,
his years like those of many generations.
61.7:
May he live forever in the presence of God.
Appoint loyal love and faithfulness to preserve him.
61.8:
So I will sing the praise of your name forever,
that I may fulfill my vows daily.

62.1:
Only for God my soul waits in silence.
From him is my salvation.
62.2:
Only he is my rock and my salvation,
my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
62.3:
How long will you attack a man?
All of you will be shattered
like a leaning wall, a tottering fence.
62.4:
They only plan to thrust him down from his high position;
they are pleased with deception.
With their mouths they bless,
but inwardly they curse. Selah
62.5:
Only for God wait in silence, O my soul,
because my hope is from him.
62.6:
Only he is my rock and my salvation,
my high stronghold; I shall not be shaken.
62.7:
On God rests my salvation and my glory;
God is my strong rock, my refuge.
62.9:
Only a vapor are men of low degree,
a deception are men of high degree.
Weighed in a balance,
together they are lighter than a vapor.
62.10:
Do not trust in extortion,
and do not put vain confidence in robbery.
If wealth increases,
do not set your heart on it.
62.12:
And to you belongs loyal love, O Lord,
because you will render to each according to his work.

63.1:
O God, you are my God;
I will seek you diligently.
My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you
as in a dry and weary land without water.
63.2:
Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary,
beholding your strength and glory.
63.3:
Because your loyal love is better than life,
my lips will praise you.
63.4:
So I will bless you while I live.
I will lift up my hands in your name.
63.5:
My soul will be satisfied as with the best and richest food,
and with joyful lips my mouth will praise.
63.6:
When I remember you on my bed,
I meditate on you in the night watches.
63.7:
Because you have been my help,
therefore in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
63.8:
My soul clings to you;
your right hand upholds me.
63.9:
But as for them who seek my life for ruin,
they will go into the depths of the earth.
63.10:
They who would deliver him to the sword
will become a portion for jackals.
63.11:
However, the king will rejoice in God.
Everyone who swears an oath by him will boast,
because the mouth of the liars will be stopped.

64.1:
Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting.
Preserve my life from the fear of the enemy.
64.2:
Hide me from the secret plots of evildoers,
from the unrest of those who do iniquity,
64.3:
who sharpen their tongue like a sword.
They bend their bow to shoot their arrows—bitter words,
64.4:
to shoot from their hiding places at the blameless.
Suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
64.5:
They encourage themselves in the evil matter.
They talk of secretly laying snares.
They say, “Who will see them?”
64.6:
They carefully plot injustices saying,
“We have perfected the perfect plot!”
Both the inner thought and heart of a man are deep.
64.7:
But God will shoot them;
with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.
64.8:
And they who would cause him to stumble,
their own tongue will be against them.
All who gaze on them will shake.
64.9:
And then all men will fear,
and will declare the working of God,
and will understand his doing.
64.10:
The righteous will rejoice in Yahweh and take refuge in him,
and all the upright in heart will boast.

65.1:
Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion,
and to you the vow shall be fulfilled.
65.2:
O you who hear prayer,
to you all flesh will come.
65.3:
Iniquities prevail over me.
As for our transgressions, you will forgive them.
65.4:
Blessed is one whom you choose and bring near,
that he may abide in your courts.
We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
your holy temple.
65.5:
By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us,
O God of our salvation,
you who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth
and of the far-off seas,
65.6:
who established the mountains by his strength,
the one who is girded with might,
65.7:
who stills the roar of the seas,
the roar of their waves,
and the commotion of the peoples,
65.8:
so that the inhabitants of the farthest reaches are in awe of your signs.
You make the dawn and sunset sing for joy.
65.9:
You care for the land and water it;
you greatly enrich it.
The stream of God is filled with waters.
You provide their grain,
for so you have established it.
65.10:
You drench its furrows,
penetrating its ridges.
With rains you soften it;
its growth you bless.
65.11:
You crown the year with your bounty,
and your wagon paths drip with richness.
65.12:
They drop on the pastures of the wilderness,
and the hills gird themselves with joy.
65.13:
The pasturelands put on flocks,
and the valleys clothe themselves with grain.
They shout in triumph;
they even sing.

66.1: Shout joyfully to God, all the earth.
66.2:
Sing the glory of his name.
Set forth his glorious praise.
66.3:
Say to God, “How awesome are your works!
Because of the greatness of your strength,
your enemies will cringe before you.
66.4:
All the earth will bow in worship to you,
and sing praise to you.
They will sing the praise of your name.” Selah
66.5:
Come and consider the works of God;
he is awesome in his dealings with the children of humankind.
66.8:
Bless our God, O peoples,
and cause the sound of his praise to be heard,
66.9:
the one who has kept our soul among the living,
and has not allowed our foot to slip.
66.10:
For you have tested us, O God;
you have tried us as silver is tried.
66.11:
You brought us into the net;
you placed a heavy burden on our backs.
66.12:
You let men ride over our heads.
We went through fire and through water,
but you have brought us out to the place of abundance.
66.13:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings.
I will pay to you my vows
66.14:
that my lips uttered,
and my mouth spoke in my distress.
66.15:
Burnt offerings of fat animals I will offer to you,
with the smoke of rams.
I will do cattle with rams. Selah
66.16:
Come and hear, all you God-fearers, and I will tell
what he has done for me.
66.17:
I called to him with my mouth,
and he was extolled with my tongue.
66.18:
If I had considered evil in my heart,
the Lord would not have listened.
66.19:
However, God has listened;
he has attended to the sound of my prayer.
66.20:
Blessed be God,
who has not turned aside my prayer,
or his loyal love from me.

67.1:
May God be gracious to us and bless us.
May he cause his face to shine toward us, Selah
67.2:
that your way may be known on the earth,
your salvation among all nations.
67.3:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
let all of the peoples praise you.
67.4:
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
because you judge the peoples with equity
and guide the nations on the earth. Selah
67.5:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
let all the peoples praise you.
67.6:
The earth has yielded its produce.
God, our God, will bless us.
67.7:
God will bless us,
and all the ends of the earth will fear him.

68.1:
God will arise; his enemies will be scattered,
and those who hate him will flee from before him.
68.2:
As smoke is driven off, you will drive them off.
As wax melts before fire,
the wicked will perish before God.
68.3:
But the righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God,
and will rejoice with joy.
68.4:
Sing to God, sing praises to his name.
Lift up a song to the rider on the clouds—his name is Yah—
and rejoice before him.
68.5:
A father to orphans and a judge for widows
is God in his holy habitation.
68.7:
O God, when you went out before your people,
when you marched through the desert, Selah
68.8:
the earth shook; the heavens also dripped rain
at the presence of God who was at Sinai,
at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
68.9:
You caused abundant rain to fall, O God.
When your inheritance was weary you revived it.
68.10:
Your community dwelled in it.
You provided in your goodness for the poor, O God.
68.11:
The Lord gives the word.
Great is the company of women who announce:
68.12:
“The kings of armies flee, they flee,
and she who remains at home divides the spoil.
68.13:
Though you men lie down between the sheepfolds,
you will be like the wings of a dove covered in silver
and its pinions in yellow gold.”
68.14:
When Shaddai scattered kings on it,
on Zalmon it snowed.
68.15:
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
68.16:
Why do you look with hostility, O many-peaked mountains?
This mountain God desires for his dwelling.
Yes, Yahweh will abide in it forever.
68.17:
The chariots of God
are twice ten thousand, with thousands doubled.
The Lord is among them at Sinai, distinctive in victory.
68.18:
You have ascended on high; you have led away captives.
You have received gifts from among humankind,
and even from the rebellious, so that Yah God may dwell there.
68.19:
Blessed be the Lord. Daily he loads us with benefits,
the God of our salvation. Selah
68.20:
Our God is a God of deliverances,
and to the Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.
68.21:
But God will shatter the head of his enemies,
the hairy scalp of the one who continues on in his guilt.
68.22:
The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan;
I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,
68.23:
so that your foot may shatter them bloody
for the tongues of your dogs to have their share from the enemies.”
68.24:
They have seen your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my king, distinctive in victory.
68.25:
Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last,
between them young women playing tambourines.
68.26:
Bless God in the assemblies,
Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.
68.27:
There is little Benjamin ruling them,
with the princes of Judah in their throng,
the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
68.28:
Your God has commanded your strength.
Show yourself strong, O God, by what you perform for us.
68.29:
Because your temple is above Jerusalem,
kings will bring tribute to you.
68.30:
Rebuke the beasts in the reeds,
the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples,
trampling the pieces of silver.
Scatter the nations who delight in battles.
68.31:
Ambassadors will come from Egypt;
Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
68.32:
O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God;
sing praise to the Lord, Selah
68.33:
to the one who rides in the highest heavens of old.
See, he gives forth his voice, a mighty voice.
68.34:
Ascribe strength to God.
His majesty is over Israel,
and his strength is in the clouds.
68.35:
Awesome are you, O God, from your sanctuary.
The God of Israel, it is he who gives strength and might to the people.
Blessed be God.

69.1:
Save me, O God,
because waters have come up to my neck.
69.2:
I sink in the mud of the deep, and there is no foothold.
I have come to watery depths,
and the torrent floods over me.
69.3:
I am weary with my calling out; my throat is parched.
My eyes are exhausted in my waiting for my God.
69.4:
More numerous than the hairs of my head
are those hating me without a cause.
Those who are destroying me—my enemies wrongfully— are mighty.
What I did not steal, I then must restore.
69.5:
O God, you yourself know my foolishness,
and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.
69.6:
Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me,
O Lord Yahweh of hosts.
Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me,
O God of Israel.
69.7:
Because on account of you I have borne reproach;
disgrace has covered my face.
69.8:
I have become a stranger to my brothers
and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,
69.9:
because the zeal for your house has consumed me,
and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.
69.10:
When I wept in the fasting of my soul,
it became reproaches for me.
69.11:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
I became for them a byword.
69.12:
Those sitting at the gate talk about me
as also the songs of the drunkards.
69.13:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time,
O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love.
Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.
69.14:
Deliver me from the mud and do not let me sink.
Let me be delivered from those who hate me
and from the watery depths.
69.15:
Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me,
or the deep swallow me,
or the pit close its mouth over me.
69.16:
Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love is good;
according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,
69.17:
and do not hide your face from your servant.
Because I am in trouble, answer me quickly.
69.18:
Draw near to my soul; redeem it.
Because of my enemies, ransom me.
69.19:
You know my reproach, my shame and my disgrace.
Fully known to you are all my adversaries.
69.20:
Reproach has broken my heart and I am sick.
And I hoped for sympathy, but there was none,
and for comforters, but I found none.
69.21:
They also gave me gall for food,
and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
69.22:
Let their table before them be a trap,
and their times of peace a snare.
69.23:
Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see,
and make their loins continually tremble.
69.24:
Pour out your indignation on them,
and let your burning anger overtake them.
69.25:
Let their camp be desolate.
Let none dwell in their tents,
69.26:
because they persecute those whom you, yourself, have struck,
and they tell of the pain of those you have wounded.
69.27:
Add guilt on top of their guilt,
and do not let them be acquitted.
69.28:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
and let them not be recorded with the righteous.
69.29:
But as for me, though I am afflicted and pained,
your salvation will protect me, O God.
69.30:
I will praise the name of God in song,
and magnify him with thanksgiving.
69.31:
For Yahweh it will be better than an ox or bull,
horned and hoofed.
69.32:
The afflicted will see and rejoice.
O God seekers, let your heart revive,
69.33:
because Yahweh hears the needy
and does not despise his own who are prisoners.
69.34:
Let heavens and earth praise him,
the seas and all that moves in them,
69.35:
because God will save Zion
and build the cities of Judah,
that they may dwell there and possess it.
69.36:
And the offspring of his servants will inherit it,
and those who love his name will abide in it.

70.1:
O God, make haste to deliver me.
O Yahweh, make haste to help me.
70.2:
Let them be ashamed and abashed
who seek my life.
Let them be repulsed and humiliated
who desire my harm.
70.3:
let them turn back because of their shame,
those who say, “Aha! Aha!”
70.4:
Let them rejoice and be glad in you,
all those who seek you.
Let them say continually, “God is great!”
those who love your salvation.
70.5:
But I am poor and needy;
O God hasten to me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O Yahweh, do not delay.

71.1:
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame.
71.2:
In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
incline your ear to me and save me.
71.4:
My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor,
71.5:
because you are my hope,
O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.
71.6:
Upon you I have leaned from birth.
It was you who took me from the womb of my mother.
My praise is of you continually.
71.7:
I have become a wonder to many,
but you are my strong refuge.
71.8:
My mouth is filled with your praise,
with your glory all the day.
71.9:
Do not cast me away in the time of old age;
when my strength fails do not abandon me.
71.10:
For my enemies talk concerning me,
and those who watch for my life conspire together,
71.11:
saying, “His God has abandoned him.
Pursue and seize him, because there is no deliverer.”
71.12:
O God, do not be far from me.
My God, hurry to help me.
71.13:
Let them be ashamed; let them perish
who are my adversaries.
Let them wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace
who seek my harm.
71.14:
But as for me, I will hope continually
and increase your praise.
71.15:
My mouth will tell of your righteousness,
your salvation all day long,
though I do not know the full sum of them.
71.16:
I will come in to tell the mighty deeds of Lord Yahweh.
I will make known your righteousness, yours only.
71.17:
O God, you have taught me from my youth,
and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.
71.18:
And even when I am old and gray,
O God, do not abandon me
until I proclaim your strength to this generation,
your power to every one that comes after.
71.19:
And your righteousness, O God, is to the height of heaven.
You who have done great things,
O God, who is like you?
71.20:
You who have caused me to see many troubles and evils,
you will again revive me.
And from the depths of the earth
you will again bring me up.
71.21:
You will increase my greatness,
and you will comfort me all around.
71.22:
On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument,
and your faithfulness, O my God.
I will sing praises to you with a lyre,
O Holy One of Israel.
71.23:
My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you,
and my soul, which you have redeemed.
71.24:
My tongue also
will speak of your righteousness all the day,
because they have been put to shame, because they have been humiliated
who seek my harm.

72.1:
O God, give your judgments to the king,
and your righteousness to the king’s son.
72.2:
May he judge your people with righteousness,
and your poor with justice.
72.3:
Let the mountains yield prosperity for the people,
and the hills in righteousness.
72.4:
May he provide justice for the poor of the people,
save the children of the needy,
and crush the oppressor.
72.5:
May he live long while the sun endures
as long as the moon for all generations.
72.6:
May he descend like rain on mown grass,
like showers watering the earth.
72.7:
May what is right blossom in his days
and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
72.8:
And may he rule from sea up to sea,
and from the River to the edges of the land.
72.9:
Let the desert dwellers bow down before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.
72.10:
Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute.
Let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts,
72.11:
and let all kings bow down to him.
Let all nations serve him.
72.12:
Indeed he will deliver the needy who is crying for help,
and the afflicted who has no helper.
72.13:
He will take pity on the helpless and needy,
and the lives of the needy he will save.
72.14:
From oppression and from violence
he will redeem their lives,
and their blood will be precious in his eyes.
72.15:
So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him,
and may prayers be offered for him continually.
May blessings be invoked for him all day long.
72.16:
May there be an abundance of grain in the land
even on the top of the mountains.
May his crop sway like the trees of Lebanon,
and may those from the city blossom like the grass of the earth.
72.17:
May his name endure forever.
May his name increase as long as the sun shines,
and let them be blessed in him.
Let all nations call him blessed.
72.18:
Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel,
who alone does wonderful things.
72.19:
And blessed be his glorious name forever,
and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
Amen and Amen.
72.20: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are completed.

73.1:
Surely God is good to Israel,
to those pure of heart.
73.2:
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled.
My steps had nearly slipped,
73.3:
because I envied the boastful
when I saw the well-being of the wicked.
73.4:
For there are no pains up to their death,
and their bodies are healthy.
73.5:
They do not have ordinary trouble,
and they are not plagued as other people.
73.6:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
an outfit of violence covers them.
73.7:
Their eye bulges from fat.
Imaginings overflow their heart.
73.8:
They mock and speak maliciously of oppression;
they speak as though from on high.
73.9:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
and their tongue roams the earth.
73.10:
Therefore his people turn there,
and abundant waters are slurped up by them.
73.11:
And they say, “How does God know?”
and, “Does the Most High have knowledge?”
73.12:
See, these are the wicked,
and they increase wealth, ever carefree.
73.13:
Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure,
and washed my hands in innocence.
73.14:
And I have been plagued all day
and rebuked every morning.
73.15:
If I had said, “I will speak thus,”
behold, I would have acted treacherously
against your children’s generation.
73.16:
When I thought about how to understand this,
it was troubling in my eyes
73.17:
until I went into the sanctuary of God.
Then I understood their fate.
73.18:
Surely you set them on slippery places.
You cause them to fall onto ruin.
73.19:
How they become a desolation in a moment!
They come to a complete end by terrors.
73.20:
Like a dream upon awakening,
when you wake up, O Lord,
you will despise their fleeting form.
73.21:
When my heart was embittered
and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,
73.22:
then I was brutish and ignorant.
With you I was like the beasts.
73.23:
But I am continually with you;
you have hold of my right hand.
73.24:
You will guide me with your advice,
and afterward you will take me into honor.
73.25:
Whom do I have in the heavens except you?
And with you I have no other desire on earth.
73.26:
My flesh and heart failed,
but God is the strength of my heart and my reward forever.
73.27:
For indeed, those distancing themselves from you will be ruined.
You destroy each who abandons you for harlotry.
73.28:
But as for me, the approach to God is for my good.
I have set the Lord Yahweh as my refuge,
in order to tell all your works.

74.1:
Why, O God, have you rejected us forever?
Why does your anger smoke
against the sheep of your pasture?
74.2:
Remember your congregation that you bought long ago,
when you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance.
Remember Mount Zion where you have dwelt.
74.3:
Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins,
to all that the enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.
74.4:
Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place;
they have set up their signs for signs.
74.5:
They are known to be like those who wield
axes in a thicket of trees.
74.6:
And now its carved works altogether
they have smashed with axe and hammer.
74.7:
They have set fire to your sanctuary.
They have defiled to the ground,
the dwelling place for your name.
74.8:
They have said in their heart,
“We will completely oppress them.”
They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.9:
We do not see our signs,
and there is no longer a prophet.
No one with us knows how long.
74.10:
How long, O God, will the adversary taunt?
Will the enemy treat your name with contempt forever?
74.11:
Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?
Take it from your bosom; destroy them!
74.12:
But God has been my king from long ago,
working salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.13:
You split open the sea by your strength;
You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
74.14:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
you gave him as food to the desert dwelling creatures.
74.15:
You split open spring and wadi.
You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
74.16:
Yours is the day, yours is the night also.
You established light and the sun.
74.17:
You defined all the boundaries of the earth;
Summer and winter—you formed them.
74.18:
O Yahweh, remember this: the enemy taunts,
and foolish people treat your name with contempt.
74.19:
Do not give to beasts the life of your dove;
do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.
74.20:
Have regard for the covenant,
because the dark places of the land are full of
the haunts of violence.
74.21:
Do not let the oppressed turn back humiliated;
let the poor and needy praise your name.
74.22:
Rise up, O God, plead your cause;
remember the reproaching of you by the foolish all day long.
74.23:
Do not forget the sound of your adversaries,
the roar of those rising up against you ascending continually.

75.2:
“I will indeed set an appointed time;
I will judge fairly.
75.3:
The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking;
I steady its columns. Selah
75.4:
I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast!’
and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn!
75.5:
Do not lift up high your horn.
Do not speak with arrogant pride.’”
75.6:
For it is not from the east or the west
and not from the south that lifting up comes,
75.7:
rather God is the judge;
one he brings low, and another he lifts up.
75.8:
For there is a cup in the hand of Yahweh
with wine that foams, fully mixed,
and he pours out from this.
Surely all the wicked of the land
will quaff it down to its dregs.
75.9:
But as for me, I will proclaim forever;
I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
75.10:
“And all the horns of the wicked I will cut off.
The horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”

76.1:
God is known in Judah.
His name is great in Israel.
76.2:
His den has been in Salem,
his lair in Zion.
76.3:
There he broke the flames of the bow,
the shield and sword and battle. Selah
76.4:
Radiant you are, majestic,
from the mountains of prey.
76.6:
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
both rider and horse slumber.
76.7:
You, indeed, are to be feared,
and who can stand before you
when you are angry?
76.8:
From heaven you proclaimed judgment.
The earth feared and was still
76.9:
when God rose for justice,
to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah
76.10:
For the anger of humankind will praise you.
You will put on the remnant of anger.
76.12:
He cuts off the spirit of leaders.
He is to be feared by the kings of the earth.

77.1:
I cry out with my voice to God;
with my voice to God, that he may hear me.
77.3:
I remember God and I groan loudly;
I meditate and my spirit grows faint.
77.4:
You hold open my eyelids.
I am troubled and cannot speak.
77.5:
I think about the days from long ago,
the years of ancient times.
77.6:
I remember my song in the night.
With my heart I meditate,
and my spirit searches to understand.
77.7:
Will the Lord reject us forever,
and will he never be pleased with us again?
77.8:
Has his loyal love ceased forever?
Is his promise ended throughout generations?
77.9:
Has God forgotten to have compassion?
Or has he closed off his mercies in anger? Selah
77.10:
So I said, “This pierces me—
the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
77.11:
I will remember the deeds of Yah.
Surely I will remember your wonders from long ago.
77.12:
I will also muse on all your work,
and meditate on your deeds.
77.13:
O God, your way is distinctive.
Who is a great god like our God?
77.14:
You are the God who works wonders;
you have made known your might among the peoples.
77.15:
With your arm you redeemed your people,
the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
77.17:
The clouds poured out water.
The skies thundered.
Your arrows also flew about.
77.19:
Your way was through the sea,
and your path through many waters.
Yet your footprints were not discerned.
77.20:
You led your people like a flock
by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.1:
Listen, O my people, to my teaching.
Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
78.2:
I will offer a parable with my mouth.
I will pour out riddles from long ago,
78.3:
that we have heard and known,
and our ancestors have told us.
78.4:
We will not hide them from their children,
telling the next generation the praises of Yahweh,
and his power and his wonders that he has done.
78.5:
For he established a testimony in Jacob,
and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our ancestors
to teach to their children,
78.6:
so that the next generation might know—
children yet to be born—
that they might rise up and tell their children,
78.7:
that they might set their confidence in God,
and not forget the deeds of God,
but keep his commandments,
78.8:
and not be like their ancestors,
a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation that did not make ready its heart,
whose spirit was not faithful to God.
78.9:
The sons of Ephraim, armed with archers,
turned back on the day of battle.
78.10:
They did not keep the covenant of God
and refused to go in his law.
78.11:
They also forgot his deeds,
and his wonders that he had shown them.
78.12:
In front of their ancestors he did a wonder,
in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
78.13:
He split the sea and caused them to go over,
and he caused waters to stand like a heap.
78.14:
And he led them with the cloud by day,
and all night with a fiery light.
78.15:
He caused rocks to split in the wilderness
and provided drink abundantly as from the depths.
78.16:
And he brought streams out of the rock
and caused water to flow down like rivers.
78.17:
But they sinned still further against him
by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
78.18:
And they tested God in their heart
by asking food for their craving.
78.19:
And they spoke against God.
They said, “Is God able
to prepare a table in the wilderness?
78.20:
Yes, he struck the rock and water flowed
and streams gushed out,
but can he also give food
or provide meat for his people?”
78.21:
Therefore Yahweh heard
and he was very angry,
and a fire was kindled against Jacob,
and his anger also rose up against Israel,
78.22:
because they did not believe God,
and they did not trust his salvation.
78.23:
Nevertheless, he commanded the skies above
and opened the doors of heaven,
78.24:
and rained down on them manna to eat
and gave them the grain of heaven.
78.25:
Humankind ate the bread of angels.
He sent them food enough to be satisfied.
78.26:
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens
and drove along the south wind by his strength.
78.27:
Then he rained meat on them like dust,
even winged birds like the sand of the seas.
78.28:
He caused them to fall in the midst of his camp,
all around his dwellings.
78.29:
So they ate and were well filled,
and he brought about what they craved.
78.30:
They had not yet turned aside from their craving,
while their food was still in their mouth,
78.31:
the anger of God rose against them,
and he killed some of the stoutest of them,
even the young men of Israel he caused to bow down in death.
78.32:
In spite of all this they sinned further
and did not believe his wonders.
78.33:
And he consumed their days with futility 
their years with terror.
78.34:
When he killed some of them, then they sought him,
and repented and earnestly sought God.
78.35:
And they remembered that God was their rock,
and God Most High their redeemer.
78.36:
But they enticed him with their mouth
and lied to him with their tongue.
78.37:
For their heart was not steadfast with him,
nor were they faithful to his covenant.
78.38:
But he was compassionate; he pardoned their guilt
and did not destroy them.
And many times he turned back his anger
and did not stir up all his wrath,
78.39:
for he remembered that they were flesh,
a passing wind that does not return.
78.40:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness
and vexed him in the wasteland!
78.41:
So they again tested God
and distressed the Holy One of Israel.
78.42:
And they did not remember his power
when he redeemed them from the enemy,
78.43:
how he performed his signs in Egypt
and his wonders in the region of Zoan,
78.44:
when he turned their rivers to blood
so they could not drink from their streams.
78.45:
He sent among them flies that devoured them
and frogs that destroyed them.
78.46:
And he gave their crop to the locusts
and their labor to the locust.
78.47:
He destroyed their vines with hail
and their sycamore trees with sleet.
78.48:
He also handed their cattle over to the hail
and their livestock to the lightning bolts.
78.49:
He sent against them his fierce anger,
rage and indignation and trouble,
a band of destroying angels.
78.50:
He cleared a path for his anger.
He did not spare them from death
but handed their life over to the plague.
78.51:
And he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
the first of their virility in the tents of Ham.
78.52:
Then he led out his people like sheep
and guided them like a herd in the wilderness.
78.53:
And he led them safely and they were not afraid,
but the sea covered their enemies.
78.54:
So he brought them to his holy territory,
this mountain his right hand acquired.
78.55:
And he drove out nations before them
and allocated them for an inheritance by boundary line,
and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
78.56:
But they tested and rebelled against God Most High
and did not keep his statutes.
78.57:
And they turned and were treacherous like their ancestors.
They twisted like a crooked bow.
78.58:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
and made him jealous with their images.
78.59:
God heard and he was very angry
and rejected Israel utterly.
78.60:
So he abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh,
the tent he had placed among humankind.
78.61:
And he gave his strength into captivity
and his splendor into the hand of the enemy.
78.62:
He also handed his people over to the sword,
and he was very angry with his inheritance.
78.63:
Fire devoured his young men,
and his young women were not praised.
78.64:
His priests fell by the sword,
and his widows did not weep.
78.65:
Then the Lord awoke like one who had been asleep,
awoke like a warrior who had been drunk with wine.
78.66:
And he beat back his enemies;
he gave them over to perpetual scorn.
78.67:
And he rejected the tent of Joseph,
and did not chose the tribe of Ephraim,
78.68:
but chose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion that he loved.
78.69:
And he built his sanctuary like the heights,
like the earth that he established forever.
78.70:
And he chose David his servant
and took him from the sheepfolds.
78.71:
He brought him from following nursing ewes
to shepherd Jacob, his people,
and Israel, his inheritance.
78.72:
And he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,
and led them by the skillfulness of his hands.

79.2:
They have given the bodies of your servants
as food for the birds of the heavens,
the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.
79.3:
They have poured out their blood like water
all around Jerusalem,
and there was none to bury them.
79.4:
We have become a taunt to our neighbors,
a derision and a scorn to those around us.
79.5:
How long, O Yahweh? Will you be angry forever?
Will your jealousy burn like fire?
79.6:
Pour out your anger on the nations
that do not know you,
and on the kingdoms
that do not call on your name,
79.7:
because they have devoured Jacob
and have laid waste his habitation.
79.9:
Help us, O God of our salvation,
for the glory of your name;
and deliver us and forgive our sins
for the sake of your name.
79.10:
Why should the nations say,
“Where is their God?”
Let it be known among the nations before our eyes,
by the avenging of the blood of your servants
that was poured out.
79.11:
Let the groaning of the prisoner come before you.
According to the greatness of your power,
spare the children appointed to death.
79.12:
And return to our neighbors sevenfold upon them
their taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord.
79.13:
Then we, your people and the flock of your pasture,
we will give thanks to you forever.
Generation after generation
we will tell of your praise.

80.1:
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel,
who leads Joseph like a flock.
Shine forth, you who sits enthroned above the cherubim.
80.2:
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
stir up your power
and come for our salvation.
80.3:
O God, restore us,
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
80.4:
O Yahweh God of hosts,
how long will you be angry
against the prayer of your people?
80.5:
You have fed them the bread of tears;
you have given them tears to drink in full measure.
80.6:
You have made us an object of strife to our neighbors,
and our enemies mock among themselves.
80.7:
O God of hosts, restore us
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
80.8:
You uprooted a vine from Egypt;
you drove out the nations and planted it.
80.9:
You prepared a place before it,
and it took deep root and filled the land.
80.10:
The mountains were covered with its shade,
and the mighty cedars with its boughs.
80.11:
It spread its branches to the sea
and its shoots to the river.
80.12:
Why have you broken down its walls,
so that all who pass on the road pluck fruit from it?
80.13:
Swine from the forests devour it
and creatures of the field feed on it.
80.14:
Please return, O God of hosts.
Observe from heaven and see,
and pay attention to this vine,
80.15:
eventhe stalk that your right hand planted,
and concerning the shoot you strengthened for yourself.
80.16:
It is burned with fire, cut down.
They perish at the rebuke of your face.
80.17:
Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
on the son of humankind whom you made strong for yourself.
80.18:
Then we will not turn back from you.
Restore us to life, and we will proclaim your name.
80.19:
O Yahweh God of hosts, restore us;
cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

81.1:
Shout out to God our strength;
shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.
81.2:
Lift up a song and strike the tambourine,
the pleasant lyre, together with the harp.
81.3:
Blow the horn at new moon,
at full moon, for our feast day,
81.4:
because it is a statute for Israel,
an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
81.5:
He made it a statute in Joseph
when he went out against the land of Egypt,
where I heard a language I did not know.
81.6:
“I removed his shoulder from a burden.
His hands were freed from the basket.
81.8:
Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
O Israel, if you would but listen to me.
81.9:
There shall be no strange god among you,
and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
81.10:
I am Yahweh your God,
who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
81.11:
But my people did not listen to my voice,
and Israel did not yield to me.
81.12:
So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart;
they walked in their counsels.
81.13:
Oh that my people would listen to me;
that Israel would walk in my ways.
81.14:
I would subdue their enemies quickly,
and turn my hand against their adversaries.
81.15:
Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him,
and their fate would be forever.
81.16:
But he would feed him from the choicest wheat,
and I would satisfy you with honey from a rock.”

82.1:
God stands in the divine assembly;
he administers judgment in the midst of the gods.
82.2:
“How long will you judge unjustly
and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah
82.3:
Judge on behalf of the helpless and the orphan;
provide justice to the afflicted and the poor.
82.4:
Rescue the helpless and the needy;
deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”
82.5:
They do not know or consider.
They go about in the darkness,
so that all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
82.6:
I have said, “You are gods,
and sons of the Most High, all of you.
82.7:
However, you will die like men,
and you will fall like one of the princes.”
82.8:
Rise up, O God, judge the earth,
because you shall inherit all the nations.

83.1:
O God, do not rest silently.
Do not keep silent or be still, O God.
83.2:
For look, your enemies roar,
and those who hate you have lifted their head.
83.3:
They devise cunning schemes against your people,
and consult together against your protected ones.
83.4:
They say, “Come, let us annihilate them from being a nation,
so that the name of Israel will be remembered no more.”
83.5:
For they have consulted together with a unified purpose.
They have made a covenant against you:
83.6:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Moab and the Hagrites,
83.7:
Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
83.8:
Assyria also has joined with them.
They provide help to the children of Lot. Selah
83.9:
Do to them as you did with Midian,
as with Sisera, as with Jabin at the wadi of Kishon.
83.10:
They were destroyed at En-dor;
they became dung for the ground.
83.11:
Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeeb,
and all their chiefs like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12:
who said, “Let us take as our possession
the pastures of God.”
83.13:
O my God, make them like the tumbleweed,
like the chaff before wind.
83.14:
As fire burns a forest,
and as a flame sets afire mountains,
83.15:
so pursue them with your tempest
and terrify them with your storm.
83.16:
Fill their faces with shame,
that they may seek your name, O Yahweh.
83.17:
Let them be ashamed and terrified forever,
and let them be humiliated and perish
83.18:
that they may know that you,
whose name is Yahweh, you alone,
are the Most High over the whole earth.

84.1:
How lovely are your dwelling places,
O Yahweh of hosts!
84.2:
My soul longs and even fails
for the courtyards of Yahweh.
My heart and flesh sing for joy
to the living God.
84.3:
Even a bird finds a home, and a swallow a nest for herself,
where she may lay her young,
near your altars, O Yahweh of hosts,
my king and my God.
84.4:
Blessed are those who dwell in your house;
they can ever praise you. Selah
84.5:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in you;
in their heart are the highways to Zion.
84.6:
Passing through the Valley of Baca,
they make it a spring.
The early rain covers it with blessings as well.
84.7:
They go from strength to strength,
until each appears before God in Zion.
84.8:
O Yahweh, God of hosts, hear my prayer;
give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah
84.9:
Look at our shield, O God,
and have regard for the face of your anointed one.
84.10:
Because better is a day in your courtyards
than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather be at the threshold of the house of my God
than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
84.12:
O Yahweh of hosts,
blessed is the man who trusts you.

85.1:
O Yahweh, you favored your land.
You restored the fortunes of Jacob.
85.2:
You took away the guilt of your people;
you covered all their sin. Selah
85.3:
You withdrew all your wrath;
you turned from your burning anger.
85.4:
Restore us, O God of our salvation,
and annul your vexation with us.
85.5:
Will you be angry against us forever?
Will you prolong your anger generation after generation?
85.6:
Will you not again revive us,
that your people might rejoice in you?
85.7:
Show us, O Yahweh, your loyal love,
and grant us your salvation.
85.8:
I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak,
because he will speak peace
to his people, even his faithful ones,
but let them not return to folly.
85.9:
Surely his salvation is near for those who fear him,
that glory may abide in our land.
85.10:
Loyal love and faithfulness will meet one another;
righteousness and peace will kiss.
85.11:
Faithfulness will sprout from the ground,
and righteousness will look down from heaven.
85.12:
Yes, Yahweh will give what is good,
and our land will give its produce.
85.13:
Righteousness will go before him,
and it will make his steps a pathway.

86.1:
Incline, O Yahweh, your ear and answer me,
because I am poor and needy.
86.2:
Watch over my life because I am faithful.
You are my God; save your servant.
I am the one who trusts you.
86.3:
Be gracious to me, O Lord,
because I call to you all day long.
86.4:
Make glad the soul of your servant,
because I desire you, O Lord.
86.5:
For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving,
and abundant in loyal love for all who call to you.
86.6:
Heed, O Yahweh, my prayer,
and attend to the voice of my supplications.
86.7:
In the day of my trouble I call to you,
because you answer me.
86.8:
There is none like you among the gods, O Lord,
and there are no works like yours.
86.9:
All the nations that you have made will come
and bow down before you, O Lord,
and glorify your name.
86.10:
For you are great and doing wondrous things;
you alone are God.
86.11:
Teach me, O Yahweh, your way,
that I may walk in your truth.
Unite my heart to fear your name.
86.12:
I will give you thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
and glorify your name forever,
86.13:
because your loyal love is great toward me,
and you will have delivered my life from Sheol below.
86.14:
O God, arrogant men have risen up against me,
even a gang of ruthless men seek my life,
but they do not set you before them.
86.15:
But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
slow to anger and abundant in loyal love and faithfulness.
86.16:
Turn to me and be gracious to me.
Give your strength to your servant,
and grant victory to the son of your maidservant.
86.17:
Do a sign that benefits me,
that those who hate me may see and be put to shame,
because you, O Yahweh, have helped me and comforted me.

87.1: His foundation is on the holy mountains.
87.2:
Yahweh loves the gates of Zion
more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
87.3:
Glorious things are spoken about you,
O city of God. Selah
87.4:
I will record those who know me
in Rahab and Babylon,
behold in Philistia and Tyre with Cush,
“This one was born there.”
87.5:
But with respect to Zion it shall be said,
“Each one was born in her,”
for the Most High himself will establish her.
87.6:
Yahweh will record in writing the peoples,
“This one was born there.” Selah
87.7:
And while dancing, singers will sing,
“All my springs are in you.”

88.1:
O Yahweh, God of my salvation,
I cry out by day and through the night before you.
88.2:
Let my prayer come before you;
incline your ear to my cry.
88.3:
For my soul is full with troubles,
and my life approaches Sheol.
88.4:
I am reckoned with those descending to the pit.
I am like a man without strength,
88.5:
set free among the dead,
like the slain lying in the grave,
whom you no longer remember,
even those cut off from your hand.
88.6:
You have set me in the pit below,
in dark places, in the depths.
88.7:
Your wrath presses upon me,
and you afflict me with all your waves. Selah
88.8:
You have removed my acquaintances far from me.
You have made me detestable to them.
I am confined and cannot go out.
88.10:
Do you work wonders for the dead?
Or do the departed spirits rise up to praise you? Selah
88.11:
Is your loyal love told in the grave,
or your faithfulness in the underworld?
88.12:
Are your wonders known in the darkness,
or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
88.13:
But as for me, I cry for help to you, O Yahweh,
and in the morning my prayer comes before you.
88.14:
Why do you reject my soul, O Yahweh?
Why do you hide your face from me?
88.15:
I am afflicted and perishing from my youth.
I bear your terrors. I am distraught.
88.16:
Your burning anger has passed over me;
your sudden fears have destroyed me.
88.17:
They surround me like water all the day;
they circle about me altogether.
88.18:
You have removed loved one and friend far from me,
my acquaintances far from my darkness.

89.1:
I will sing forever of Yahweh’s acts of loyal love.
From generation to generation
I will make known your faithfulness with my mouth.
89.2:
For I say, “Forever your loyal love is built up.
The heavens you have established with your faithfulness in them.”
89.3:
“I made a covenant with my chosen one;
I swore an oath to David my servant:
89.4:
‘I will establish your descendants forever,
and I will build up your throne from generation to generation.’” Selah
89.5:
And so the heavens will praise your wonderful deed, O Yahweh,
even your faithfulness, in the assembly of the holy ones.
89.6:
For who in the sky is equal to Yahweh?
Who is like Yahweh among the sons of God,
89.7:
a God feared greatly in the council of the holy ones,
and awesome above all surrounding him?
89.8:
O Yahweh God of hosts,
who is mighty like you, O Yah,
with your faithfulness surrounding you?
89.9:
You are ruling the surging of the sea.
When its waves rise, you yourself still them.
89.10:
You yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain;
you scattered your enemies with your strong arm.
89.11:
The heavens are yours, the earth yours as well,
the world with its fullness, because you founded them.
89.12:
North and south, you created them;
Tabor and Hermon shout joyfully over your name.
89.13:
You have a mighty arm;
Your hand is strong; your right hand reaches high.
89.14:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.
Loyal love and faithfulness come before your face.
89.15:
Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout;
O Yahweh, they walk about in the light of your countenance.
89.16:
In your name they rejoice all the day,
and in your righteousness they rise up.
89.17:
For you are the glory of their strength,
and by your favor our horn rises up,
89.18:
because our shield belongs to Yahweh,
and our king to the Holy One of Israel.
89.19:
Formerly you spoke in a vision
to your faithful ones, and said,
“I have bestowed help on a mighty man;
I have exalted one chosen from the people.
89.20:
I have found David, my servant.
With my holy oil I have anointed him,
89.21:
with whom my hand will be steadfast.
Surely my arm will strengthen him.
89.22:
The enemy will not deceive him,
and no evil man will afflict him.
89.23:
But I will crush his adversaries before him,
and I will strike those who hate him.
89.24:
And so my faithfulness
and my loyal love will be with him,
and in my name his horn will rise up.
89.25:
And I will set his hand on the sea
and his right hand on the rivers.
89.26:
He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father,
my God, and the rock of my salvation.’
89.27:
I will also make him the firstborn,
the highest of the kings of the earth.
89.28:
Forever I will keep my loyal love for him,
and my covenant will be reliable for him.
89.29:
I will also establish his offspring forever,
and his throne as the days of the heavens.
89.30:
If his sons forsake my law
and do not walk in my judgments,
89.31:
if they defile my statutes
and do not keep my commandments,
89.32:
then I will punish their transgression with a rod,
and their guilt with wounds.
89.33:
But I will not break off my loyal love from him,
and I will not be false against my faithfulness.
89.34:
I will not defile my covenant,
or alter what proceeded from my lips.
89.35:
Once I have sworn by my holiness,
‘I will surely not lie to David,
89.36:
His offspring will endure forever,
and his throne as the sun before me.
89.37:
Like the moon it will be steadfast forever,
and like an enduring witness in the sky.’” Selah
89.38:
But you have spurned and rejected;
you are very angry with your anointed one.
89.39:
You have repudiated the covenant with your servant;
you have defiled his crown in the dirt.
89.40:
You have broken down all his walls;
you have made his fortifications a ruin.
89.41:
All passing along the road plunder him;
he has become a taunt to his neighbors.
89.42:
You have raised the right hand of his adversaries.
You have made all his enemies rejoice.
89.43:
You have also turned back the edge of his sword
and have not helped him stand his ground in the battle.
89.44:
You have made his splendor to cease,
and cast his throne to the ground.
89.45:
You have cut short the days of his youth;
you have covered him with shame. Selah
89.46:
How long, O Yahweh? Will you hide yourself forever?
Will your wrath burn like fire forever?
89.47:
Remember what my lifespan is.
Remember for what vanity
you have created all the children of humankind.
89.48:
What man can live on and not see death?
Can he deliver his life from the power of Sheol? Selah
89.49:
Where are your former acts of loyal love, O Lord,
that you swore to David by your faithfulness?
89.50:
Remember, O Lord the taunting of your servants,
how I bear in my bosom the taunts of all the many peoples,
89.51:
by which your enemies taunt, O Yahweh,
by which they taunt the steps of your anointed one.
89.52:
Blessed be Yahweh forever.
Amen and Amen.

90.1: O Lord, you have been our help in all generations.
90.2:
Before the mountains were born
and you brought forth the earth and the world,
even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.
90.3:
You return man to the dust,
saying, “Return, O sons of man.”
90.4:
For a thousand years in your eyes
are like yesterday when it passes,
or like a watch in the night.
90.5:
You sweep them away like a flood.
They fall asleep.
In the morning they are like grass that sprouts anew.
90.6:
In the morning it blossoms and sprouts anew;
by evening it withers and dries up.
90.7:
For we are brought to an end by your anger,
and we hasten off by your wrath.
90.8:
You have put our iniquities before you,
our hidden sins into the light of your countenance.
90.9:
For all of our days dwindle away in your rage;
we complete our years like a sigh.
90.10:
As for the days of our years, within them are seventy years
or if by strength eighty years, and their pride is trouble and disaster,
for it passes quickly and we fly away.
90.11:
Who knows the strength of your anger,
and your rage consistent with the fear due you?
90.12:
So teach us to number our days
that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
90.13:
Return, O Yahweh. How long?
And have compassion on your servants.
90.14:
Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love,
that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
90.15:
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
for as many years as we have seen calamity.
90.16:
Let your work be visible to your servants,
and your majesty to their children.
90.17:
And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us,
and establish for us the work of our hands,
yes, the work of our hands, establish it.

91.1:
One who lives in the secret place of the Most High
will lodge in the shadow of Shaddai.
91.2:
I will say to Yahweh, “You are my refuge and my fortress,
my God in whom I trust.”
91.3:
For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler,
from the plague of destruction.
91.4:
With his feathers he will cover you,
and under his wings you can take refuge.
His faithfulness will be a shield and a buckler.
91.5:
You need not fear the terror of the night,
or the arrow that flies by day,
91.6:
or the plague that spreads in the darkness,
or the destruction that devastates at noon.
91.7:
A thousand may fall at your side,
and ten thousand at your right hand,
but it will not come near you.
91.8:
You will only look with your eyes,
and see the punishment of the wicked.
91.9:
For you, O Yahweh, are my refuge.
You have made the Most High your dwelling place.
91.10:
No harm will befall you,
and no plague will come near your tent.
91.11:
For he will command his angels concerning you,
to watch over you in all your ways.
91.12:
In their hands they will bear you up,
lest you strike your foot against a stone.
91.13:
You will tread on lion and viper;
you will trample young lion and serpent.
91.14:
Because he loves me, therefore I will deliver him;
I will protect him because he knows my name.
91.16:
With long life I will satisfy him,
and show him my salvation.

92.1:
It is good to give thanks to Yahweh,
and to sing praise concerning your name, O Most High;
92.2:
to declare in the morning your loyal love
and your faithfulness in the night,
92.3:
on the ten string, and on the harp,
with a melody on the lyre.
92.4:
For you, O Yahweh, have made me glad by your work;
by the deeds of your hands I sing for joy.
92.5:
How great are your deeds, O Yahweh;
how very deep are your thoughts.
92.6:
The brutish man does not know,
and the fool cannot understand this.
92.7:
When the wicked flourish like grass
and all the workers of evil blossom,
it is so they can be destroyed forever.
92.8: But you are on high forever, O Yahweh.
92.9:
For behold, your enemies, O Yahweh,
for behold, your enemies will perish.
All the workers of evil will be scattered.
92.10:
But you have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox;
you have anointed me with fresh oil.
92.11:
And so my eye looks on my enemies.
My ears hear those evildoers who rise up against me.
92.12:
The righteous will flourish like the date palm.
They will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
92.13:
Planted in the house of Yahweh,
they will flourish in the courts of our God.
92.14:
They will still prosper in old age.
They will be fat and luxuriant,
92.15:
to declare that Yahweh is upright.
He is my rock, and there is no injustice in him.

93.1:
Yahweh is king; he clothes himself with majesty.
Yahweh clothes himself; he girds himself with might.
Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved.
93.2:
Your throne is established from of old;
you are from everlasting.
93.4:
Mightier than the rumblings of many waters,
mightier than the mighty breakers of the sea,
Yahweh on high is mighty.
93.5:
Your testimonies are fully reliable.
Holiness is fitting for your house,
O Yahweh, forever.

94.1:
O Yahweh, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth.
94.2:
Rise up, O Judge of the earth.
Repay upon the proud what is their rightful due.
94.3:
How long will the wicked, O Yahweh,
how long will the wicked exult?
94.4:
They gush words unrestrained.
All the evildoers boast.
94.5:
They crush your people, O Yahweh;
they oppress your inheritance.
94.6:
They kill widow and stranger,
and they murder orphans,
94.7:
while they say, “Yah does not see,”
and “The God of Jacob does not pay attention.”
94.8:
You pay attention, O brutes among the people.
And you fools, when you will show insight?
94.9:
Will the one who planted the ear not hear?
Will the one who formed the eye not see?
94.10:
Will the one who instructs nations not rebuke,
the one who teaches humankind knowledge?
94.11:
Yahweh knows the thoughts of humankind,
that they are to no purpose.
94.12:
Blessed is the man, O Yah, whom you instruct
and teach from your law,
94.13:
to give him rest from days of trouble,
until a pit is dug for the wicked.
94.14:
For Yahweh will not abandon his people,
nor forsake his inheritance.
94.15:
For judgment will return to righteousness,
and all the upright in heart will follow after it.
94.16:
Who rose up for me against the wicked?
Who stood up for me against the workers of iniquity?
94.17:
If Yahweh had not been my help,
my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.
94.18:
When I thought, “My foot is slipping,”
your loyal love, O Yahweh, supported me.
94.19:
When my troubled thoughts were many within me,
your consolations cheered my soul.
94.20:
Can there be allied with you a throne of destruction,
one that forms trouble based on statute?
94.21:
They band together against the life of the righteous,
and declare the blameless guilty of blood.
94.22:
But Yahweh has become my high stronghold,
and my God has become my rock of refuge.
94.23:
And he will repay on them their iniquity,
and by their evil he will destroy them.
Yahweh our God will destroy them.

95.1:
Come, let us sing for joy to Yahweh;
let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
95.2:
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
with songs let us shout joyfully to him.
95.3:
For Yahweh is the great God,
and the great king over all gods,
95.4:
in whose hand are the unexplored places of the earth,
and the heights of the mountains are his,
95.5:
to whom belongs the sea that he made, 
and the dry land that his hands formed.
95.6:
Come in, let us worship and bow down;
let us kneel before Yahweh, our maker.
95.7:
For he is our God,
and we are the people of his pasture
and the sheep of his hand.
Today if you will hear his voice:
95.8:
“Do not harden your heart as at Meribah,
as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
95.9:
when your ancestors tried me.
They put me to the test,
even though they had seen my work.
95.10:
For forty years I loathed that generation,
and said, ‘They are a people whose heart wanders.
And my ways they do not know.’
95.11:
Therefore I swore in my anger,
‘They shall surely not enter into my rest.’”

96.1:
Sing to Yahweh a new song;
sing to Yahweh, all the earth.
96.2:
Sing to Yahweh; bless his name.
Announce his salvation from day to day.
96.3:
Tell his glory among the nations,
his marvelous works among all the peoples.
96.4:
For Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise;
he is to be feared above all gods.
96.5:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
but Yahweh made the heavens.
96.6:
Splendor and majesty are before him;
strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
96.7:
Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of the peoples,
ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
96.8:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name;
bring an offering and come into his courts.
96.9:
Worship Yahweh in holy array;
tremble before him, all the earth.
96.10:
Say among the nations, “Yahweh is king!
Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved.
He will judge the peoples fairly.”
96.11:
Let the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice.
Let the sea with its fullness roar.
96.12:
Let the field with all that is in it exult.
Then all the trees of the forests will sing for joy
96.13:
before Yahweh, for he is coming;
for he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness,
and the peoples with his faithfulness.

97.1:
Yahweh is king! Let the earth rejoice;
let many coastlands be glad.
97.2:
Cloud and thick darkness are surrounding him;
righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
97.3:
Fire goes before him,
and devours his enemies round about.
97.4:
His lightnings light the world;
the earth sees and trembles.
97.5:
The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh,
at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
97.6:
The heavens declare his righteousness,
and all the peoples see his glory.
97.7:
Let all who serve an image be ashamed,
those who boast about idols.
Worship him, all you gods.
97.8:
Zion hears and is glad,
and the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your judgments, O Yahweh.
97.9:
For you, O Yahweh, are most high over all the earth.
You are highly exalted above all gods.
97.11:
Light is sown for the righteous,
and joy for the upright in heart.
97.12:
Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous,
and give thanks to his holy name.

98.1:
Sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done wonders.
His right hand and his holy arm have secured his victory.
98.2:
Yahweh has made known his salvation;
to the eyes of the nations he has revealed his righteousness.
98.3:
He has remembered his loyal love and his faithfulness
to the house of Israel.
All the ends of the earth have seen
the salvation of our God.
98.4:
Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth.
Be cheerful and sing for joy and sing praises.
98.5:
Sing praises to Yahweh with lyre,
with lyre and melodious sound.
98.6:
With trumpets and sound of horn,
shout joyfully before the king, Yahweh.
98.7:
Let the sea with its fullness roar,
the world and those who live in it.
98.8:
Let the rivers clap their hands.
Let the hills sing joyfully together
98.9:
before Yahweh, for he is coming
to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness
and the peoples with equity.

99.1:
Yahweh is king; let the peoples tremble.
He sits enthroned between the cherubim. Let the earth shake.
99.2:
Yahweh is great in Zion,
and he is exalted over all the peoples.
99.3:
Let them praise your great and fearful name.
He is holy.
99.5:
Exalt Yahweh our God,
and worship at his footstool.
He is holy.
99.7:
He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud.
They kept his testimonies and the statute he gave to them.
99.8:
O Yahweh our God, you answered them.
You were a forgiving God to them,
but an avenger of their wrong deeds.
99.9:
Exalt Yahweh our God,
and worship at his holy mountain,
for Yahweh our God is holy.

100.1: Shout in triumph to Yahweh, all the earth.
100.2:
Serve Yahweh with joy;
come into his presence with exultation.
100.4:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving,
his courts with praise.
Give thanks to him; bless his name.
100.5:
For Yahweh is good; his loyal love is forever,
and his faithfulness is from generation to generation.

101.1:
I will sing of loyal love and justice;
I will sing praises to you, O Yahweh.
101.2:
I will give attention to the way of integrity.
When will you come to me?
I will walk in the integrity of my heart
in the midst of my house.
101.3:
I will not set before my eyes
any wicked thing.
I hate the work of those who fall away;
it will not cling to me.
101.4:
A perverse heart will depart from me;
I will not know evil.
101.5:
One who slanders his neighbor in secret,
him I will destroy.
One haughty of eyes and arrogant of heart,
him I will not endure.
101.6:
My eyes will be on the faithful of the land,
that they may live with me.
He who walks in the way of integrity,
he shall minister to me.
101.7:
There will not live in the midst of my house
a worker of deceit.
One who speaks lies
will not remain before my eyes.
101.8:
Each morning,
I will destroy all the wicked of the land,
cutting off from the city of Yahweh all evildoers.

102.1:
O Yahweh, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.
102.2:
Do not hide your face from me
in the day of my trouble.
Incline your ear to me.
In the day I call, answer me quickly,
102.3:
for my days vanish in smoke,
and my bones are charred like a hearth.
102.4:
My heart is struck like grass and withers.
Indeed, I forget to eat my bread.
102.5:
Because of the sound of my groaning
my bones cling to my skin.
102.6:
I am like an owl of the wilderness;
I am like a little owl of the ruins.
102.7:
I lie awake and I am
like a lone bird on a roof.
102.8:
All the day my enemies reproach me;
those who mock me swear oaths against me.
102.9:
Indeed, I eat ashes like bread
and mix my drink with tears
102.10:
because of your indignation and anger,
for you have picked me up and thrown me away.
102.11:
My days are like a lengthened shadow,
and I wither like grass.
102.12:
But you, O Yahweh, abide forever,
and your remembrance from generation to generation.
102.13:
You rise up and take pity on Zion,
because it is time to favor it,
for the appointed time has come.
102.14:
Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
and show favor to its dust.
102.15:
Then the nations will fear the name of Yahweh,
and all the kings of the earth your glory.
102.16:
For Yahweh will rebuild Zion;
he will appear in his glory.
102.17:
He will turn his attention to the prayer of the destitute
and will not despise their prayer.
102.18:
Let this be written for the next generation,
so that a people yet to be created may praise Yah,
102.19:
that he looked down from his holy height.
Yahweh looked from heaven over the earth
102.20:
to hear the groaning of the prisoner,
to liberate those destined to die,
102.21:
so that they may make known in Zion the name of Yahweh,
and his praise in Jerusalem,
102.22:
when the peoples assemble,
together with kingdoms, to serve Yahweh.
102.23:
He has broken my strength along the way;
he has cut short my days.
102.24:
I say, “My God, do not carry me off
from my life in the middle of my days.”
Your years continue throughout all generations.
102.25:
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth,
and the heavens are the work of your hands.
102.26:
They will perish, but you will endure.
And like a garment they will all wear out,
you will replace them like clothing, and they will be set aside.
102.27:
But you are the same,
and your years do not end.
102.28:
The children of your servants will continue,
and their descendants will be established before you.

103.1:
Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
and all within me, bless his holy name.
103.2:
Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
and do not forget all his benefits:
103.3:
who forgives all your iniquity,
who heals all your diseases,
103.4:
who redeems your life from the pit,
who crowns you with loyal love and mercies,
103.5:
who satisfies your life with good
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
103.6:
Yahweh does deeds of justice
and judgments for all who are oppressed,
103.7:
who made known his ways to Moses,
his deeds to the people of Israel.
103.8:
Yahweh is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger and abundant in loyal love.
103.9:
He does not dispute continually,
nor keep his anger forever.
103.10:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
nor repaid us according to our iniquities.
103.11:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
so his loyal love prevails over those who fear him.
103.12:
As far as east is from west,
so he has removed far from us the guilt of our transgressions.
103.13:
As a father pities his children,
so Yahweh pities those who fear him.
103.14:
For he knows our frame.
He remembers that we are dust.
103.15:
As for man, his days are like the grass.
As the flower of the field, so he blossoms.
103.16:
When the wind passes over it, it is no more,
and its place knows it no longer.
103.17:
But the loyal love of Yahweh
is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him,
and his righteousness to their children’s children,
103.18:
to those who keep his covenant
and remember to do his precepts.
103.19:
Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens,
and his kingdom rules over all.
103.20:
Bless Yahweh, you his angels,
you mighty heroes who do his word
by obeying the sound of his word.
103.21:
Bless Yahweh, all you his hosts,
you his attendants who do his will.
103.22:
Bless Yahweh, all his works,
in all the places of his dominion.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.

104.1:
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
O Yahweh my God, you are very great.
You clothe yourself with splendor and majesty,
104.2:
you who cover yourself with light as with a garment,
who stretch out the heavens like a tent curtain,
104.3:
the one who sets beams in the waters for his upper chambers,
who makes clouds his chariot,
who rides on the wings of the wind,
104.4:
who makes his messengers the winds,
his attendants a flame of fire.
104.5:
He established the earth on her foundations,
so that it will not be moved forever and ever.
104.6:
You covered it with the deep as with a garment.
The waters stood above the mountains.
104.7:
At your rebuke they fled;
at the sound of your thunder they ran off.
104.8:
They ascended the mountains and drained though the valleys
to the place that you established for them.
104.9:
You set a boundary that they may not cross over,
so that they would not return to cover the earth.
104.10:
You are the one who sends forth springs into the valleys;
they flow between the mountains.
104.11:
They give drink for every beast of the field.
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12:
Along them the birds of the heavens abide.
From among the branches they sing.
104.13:
You are the one who waters the mountains
from his upper chambers.
The earth is full with the fruit of your labors:
104.14:
who causes grass to grow for the cattle
and herbs for the service of humankind,
to bring forth food from the earth,
104.15:
and wine that makes glad the heart of man,
so that their faces shine from oil,
and bread that strengthens the heart of man.
104.16:
The trees of Yahweh drink their fill,
the cedars of Lebanon that he planted,
104.17:
where birds make their nest.
The stork has its home in the fir trees.
104.18:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
the cliffs are a refuge for the rock badgers.
104.19:
He made the moon for appointed times;
the sun knows its time for setting.
104.20:
You make darkness, and it is night,
when all the animals of the forest creep about.
104.21:
The young lions are roaring for the prey
and seeking their food from God.
104.22:
When the sun rises, they gather together
and lie down in their dens.
104.23:
Humankind goes out to its work,
and to its labor until evening.
104.25:
This is the great and wide sea,
in which are moving animals without number,
living things small and great.
104.26:
There the ships sail.
Leviathan is there that you formed to play with.
104.27:
They all wait for you
to give them their food at the proper time.
104.28:
You give to them; they gather it.
You open your hand, they are filled with what is good.
104.29:
You hide your face, they are terrified.
You take away their breath, they die
and return to their dust.
104.30:
You send forth your Spirit, they are created,
and you renew the face of the ground.
104.31:
May the glory of Yahweh endure forever.
May Yahweh be glad in his works,
104.32:
the one who looks at the earth and it quakes,
and touches the mountains and they smoke.
104.33:
I will sing to Yahweh throughout my life;
I will sing praise to my God while I remain alive.
104.34:
May my meditation be pleasing to him.
I will be glad in Yahweh.
104.35:
Let sinners perish completely from the earth,
and the wicked not remain alive.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
Praise Yah.

105.1:
Give thanks to Yahweh; proclaim his name;
make known his deeds among the peoples.
105.2:
Sing to him; sing praises concerning him;
tell of all his wonderful works.
105.3:
Boast about his holy name.
Let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
105.4:
Make supplication to Yahweh and his might;
seek his face continually.
105.5:
Remember his wonders that he has done,
his signs and the judgments of his mouth,
105.6:
O offspring of Abraham his servant,
you descendants of Jacob, his chosen ones.
105.7:
He is Yahweh our God;
his judgments are in all the earth.
105.9:
that he made with Abraham,
and by his oath swore to Isaac.
105.10:
He then confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
105.11:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
as the allotment that is your inheritance.”
105.12:
When they were few in number—
a trifle—and were sojourners in it,
105.13:
and they wandered about among the nations,
from one kingdom to another people,
105.14:
he allowed no one to oppress them,
and he rebuked kings on account of them,
105.15:
“Do not touch my anointed ones,
nor harm my prophets.”
105.16:
Then he called for a famine upon the land;
he broke every supply of bread.
105.17:
He sent a man on ahead of them;
Joseph was sold as a slave.
105.18:
They clamped his feet in fetters.
His neck went into irons.
105.19:
Until the time his word came about,
the word of Yahweh tested him.
105.20:
The king sent and he freed him;
the ruler of the peoples sent and let him loose.
105.21:
He made him lord of his house
and ruler of all his possessions,
105.22:
to obligate his officials as he saw fit
and teach his elders wisdom.
105.23:
Then Israel came to Egypt,
and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Ham.
105.24:
And he made his people very fruitful.
He also made them stronger than their enemies.
105.25:
He turned their heart to hate his people,
to deal deceitfully against his servants.
105.26:
He sent his servant Moses,
together with Aaron whom he had chosen.
105.27:
They set before them the words concerning his signs
and portents in the land of Ham.
105.28:
He sent darkness and made it dark,
and they did not rebel against his words.
105.29:
He turned their waters into blood
and it killed their fish.
105.30:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
even in the chambers of their kings.
105.31:
He spoke, and there came flies
and gnats throughout all their territory.
105.32:
He gave hail for their rains
and the fire of lightning in their land.
105.33:
And he struck their vines and fig trees,
and shattered the trees of their territory.
105.34:
He spoke and there came locusts
and young locusts without number.
105.35:
And they ate up all the vegetation in their land,
and they ate up the fruit of their ground.
105.36:
And he struck down all the firstborn in their land,
the first of all their virility.
105.37:
Then he brought them out with silver and gold,
and there was none among his tribes who stumbled.
105.38:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
because the fear of them had fallen upon them.
105.39:
He spread out a cloud for a covering,
and fire to give light at night.
105.40:
They asked, and he brought quail,
and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
105.41:
He opened the rock and waters flowed;
they coursed through the dry places like a river.
105.42:
For he remembered his holy promise;
he remembered Abraham his servant.
105.43:
And so he brought out his people with joy,
his chosen ones with rejoicing.
105.44:
And he gave to them the lands of the nations,
and they inherited the labor of the peoples,
105.45:
so that they might observe his statutes,
and keep his laws.
Praise Yah.

106.1:
Praise Yah. Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his loyal love is forever.
106.2:
Who can utter the mighty deeds of Yahweh,
or proclaim all his praise?
106.3:
Blessed are those who observe justice,
he who does righteousness at all times.
106.4:
Remember me, O Yahweh, when you show favor to your people.
Look after me when you deliver,
106.5:
that I may see the good done your chosen ones,
to be glad in the joy of your nation,
to glory together with your inheritance.
106.6:
We have sinned along with our ancestors.
We have committed iniquity; we have incurred guilt.
106.7:
Our ancestors in Egypt did not understand your wonderful works.
They did not remember your many acts of loyal love,
and so they rebelled by the sea at the Red Sea.
106.8:
Yet he saved them for the sake of his name,
to make known his might.
106.9:
So he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up,
and he led them through the deep as through a desert.
106.10:
Thus he saved them from the hand of the hater
and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11:
But waters covered their adversaries;
not one of them survived.
106.12:
Then they believed his words;
they sang his praise.
106.13:
They quickly forgot his works;
they did not wait for his counsel.
106.14:
And they craved intensely in the wilderness,
and tested God in the desert.
106.15:
So he gave to them their request,
but he sent leanness into their souls.
106.16:
And they were jealous of Moses in the camp,
and of Aaron, the holy one of Yahweh.
106.17:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
and it covered over the gang of Abiram.
106.18:
Also fire burned in their assembly;
the flame devoured the wicked.
106.19:
They made a calf at Horeb
and bowed down to a cast image.
106.20:
And so they exchanged their glory
for an image of an ox that eats grass.
106.21:
They forgot God their Savior,
who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22:
wonders in the land of Ham,
awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
106.23:
So he said he would exterminate them,
had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him,
to reverse his wrath from destroying them.
106.24:
Then they refused the desirable land;
they did not believe his word,
106.25:
but grumbled in their tents.
They did not obey the voice of Yahweh.
106.26:
So he made an oath against them,
to make them drop in the wilderness,
106.27:
and to disperse their descendants among the nations
and to scatter them among the lands.
106.28:
They also attached themselves to Baal of Peor,
and they ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
106.29:
Thus they provoked to anger by their deeds,
and a plague broke out among them.
106.30:
Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
and so the plague was stopped,
106.31:
and it was reckoned to him as righteousness
throughout all generations.
106.32:
They also angered God at the waters of Meribah,
and it went badly for Moses on account of them,
106.33:
because they rebelled against his Spirit,
and he spoke thoughtlessly with his lips.
106.34:
They did not exterminate the peoples,
as Yahweh had commanded them,
106.35:
but they mingled with the nations
and learned their works,
106.36:
and served their idols,
which became a snare to them.
106.37:
They even sacrificed their sons and daughters
to the demons,
106.38:
and they poured out innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
